symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart
symbols.description:
The SmartChart control creates a chart based on the OData metadata and the provided configuration. To use the control, the entitySet property must be specified. This property is used to fetch the metadata, from which the chart UI will be generated.
Based on the chartType property, this control will render initially the corresponding chart.
Note: Most of the properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: chartBindingPath
properties.description: Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart to be created by the SmartChart control.

properties.name: currentVariantId
properties.description: Retrieves or applies the current variant.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns.
Note This is not a dynamic property.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

properties.name: ignoreFromPersonalisation
properties.description:
CSV of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: ignoredChartTypes
properties.description:
CSV of fields that is not shown in the list of available chart types.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartChart control.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: legendVisible
properties.description:
Set chart's legend properties.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: noData
properties.description:
Defines the custom text that will be displayed in case no data is found for the current binding.

Since: 1.46.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data.

properties.name: requestAtLeastFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
Chart selection mode. Supported values are sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Single or sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Multi, case insensitive, always return in upper case. Unsupported values will be ignored.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showChartTooltip
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true , an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip will be created and shown when hovering over a data point.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showChartTypeSelectionButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart type selection button.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: showDetailsButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Details button. If set to true, the datapoint tooltip will be disabled as the information of selected datapoints will be found in the details popover. This will also set the drill-down button to invisible.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showDimensionsTitle
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the title in the dimension area of the chart.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: showDownloadButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart download button.

Since: 1.39.

properties.name: showDrillBreadcrumbs
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showDrillButtons
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Drill Up and Drill Down buttons.

properties.name: showFullScreenButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showLegendButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showMeasuresTitle
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the title in the measure area of the chart.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: showSemanticNavigationButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showToolbar
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the toolbar.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: showVariantManagement
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Variant Management.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showZoomButtons
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: smartFilterId
properties.description: ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control. If specified, the SmartChart control searches for the SmartFilter control (also in the closest parent view) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter control to fetch data, show overlay etc.

properties.name: toolbarStyle
properties.description:
Defines the visual style of the smart charts Toolbar. Note: The visual styles are theme-dependent.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: useChartPersonalisation
properties.description: If set to true, personalized chart settings are defined. If you want to persist the chart personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

properties.name: useListForChartTypeSelection
properties.description:
Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.

Since: 1.38.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

properties.name: useTooltip
properties.description:
Specifies weather an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip or sap.viz.ui5.controls.Popover is used. If set to true, a tooltip will be displayed, a popover otherwise.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: useVariantManagement
properties.description: If set to true, variants are used. As a prerequisite, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActionGroups
aggregations.description: Actions on group level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActions
aggregations.description: Actions on footer level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsItemActions
aggregations.description: Actions on item level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: A custom toolbar that can be specified by the user to define their own buttons, icons, etc. If this is added, the SmartChart control does not create its own toolbar, but uses this one instead. However, if default actions, such as showSemanticNavigation, showFullScreenButton etc. are set, these actions are added at the left-hand side of the toolbar.

associations.name: smartVariant
associations.description: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.

annotations.name: semanticObject
annotations.description:
Defines a name of the SemanticObject that can be represented with an EntitySet, EntityType or identified by a Property. With this annotation in place, the SemanticObjectController will provide all the available features for the SmartChart control. XML Example of OData V4 with SemanticObject on ProductName
Note: Navigation targets are determined using CrossApplicationNavigation of the unified shell service.

   <Annotations Target="ProductName">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticObject" String="SemanticObjectName" />
  </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: fieldVisible
annotations.description:
Defines whether a field in the SmartChart control is visible. The SmartChart interprets the EnumMember FieldControlType/Hidden of the FieldControl annotation for setting the visibility. Note: Currently only FieldControlType/Hidden is supported for statically hiding the fields. XML Example of OData V4 with hidden Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Property Name="Customer">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>

For OData v2 the sap:visible annotation on the Property can be used to assign visibility.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:visible="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:visible="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: presentationVariant
annotations.description:
Renders the initial chart fields for the SmartChart control. A PropertyPath and an AnnotationPath can be used for constructing PresentationVariant annotation. XML Example of OData V4 with Customer and CompanyCode Properties as PresentationVariant

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Visualizations">
         <Collection>
           <AnnotationPath>@UI.Chart</AnnotationPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
       <PropertyValue Property="RequestAtLeast">
         <Collection>
           <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="SortOrder">
           <Collection>
             <Record>
               <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode"/>
               <PropertyValue Property="Descending" Bool="true"/>
             </Record>
             <Record>
               <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer"/>
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a chart based on the information that is provided within the Chart annotation. Chart annotation must be defined for an EntityType

XML Example of OData V4 with Chart Annotation and ChartType Column Chart

   <Annotations Target="Item" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Line Items" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInTransactionCurrency</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the UI.DataPoint that is provided by the measure attributes, semantic patterns and coloring can be defined for the chart. The UI.DataPoint annotation must be defined for an EntityType XML Example of OData V4 with DataPoint Annotation with semantic coloring For more information see sap.chart.ColoringType.Criticality

   <Annotations Target="Item" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Line Items" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInTransactionCurrency</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
              <Record>
                 <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#semanticColoring" />
              </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="semanticColoring" >
	  <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
		<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
		<PropertyValue Property="Criticality" EnumMember="sap.chart.ColoringType.Negative" />
	  </Record>
    </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

Using this UI.DataPoint annotation, the semantic coloring for a measure changes as follows:

   var oColorings = {
       Criticality: {
          MeasureValues: {
              "AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency": {
                   Static: sap.chart.ColoringType.Negative
              }
          }
   }

XML Example of OData V4 with DataPoint Annotation with semantic pattern For more information see sap.chart.data.MeasureSemantics

   <Annotations Target="Item" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Line Items" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>TargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
              <Record>
                 <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#semanticPattern" />
              </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="semanticPattern" >
	  <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
		<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
		<PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="TargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
	  </Record>
    </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

Using this UI.DataPoint annotation, the semantics of the chart measures are set as follows:

var oAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency = oChart.getMeasureByName("AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency");
oAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency.setSemantics(sap.chart.data.MeasureSemantics.Actual);

var oTargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency = oChart.getMeasureByName("TargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency");
oTargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency.setSemantics(sap.chart.data.MeasureSemantics.Reference);

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.0.

annotations.name: text
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property. If no text arrangement has been defined, the default display behavior is TextFirst.

An example how this is set in OData v4 is shown here:

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="ProductName">

In OData v2 it looks like this:

    <Property name="ProductId" ... sap:text="ProductName"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: textArrangement
annotations.description:
Describes the arrangement of an ID value and its description.

The following enumeration members are allowed:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextSeparate: The control displays the specified ID only.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst: The control displays the specified description followed by its ID.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast: The control displays the specified ID followed by its description.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextOnly: The control displays the specified description only.

The TextArrangement annotation is usually used as a child of a com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on an entity's property

<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Category">
	<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CategoryName">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast" />
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on entity Product

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.ProductType">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control that is generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new SmartChart instance.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: afterVariantApply

parameters.name: currentVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been applied.

events.name: afterVariantInitialise
events.description: This event is fired after the variant management in the SmartChart control has been initialized.

events.name: afterVariantSave

parameters.name: currentVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been saved. This event can be used to retrieve the ID of the saved variant.

events.name: beforeRebindChart

parameters.name: bindingParams
parameters.description: The bindingParams object contains filters, sorters, and other binding-related information for the chart

parameters.name: preventChartBind
parameters.description: If set to true by the listener, binding is prevented

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: The combined filter array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Filter instances of the SmartChart and SmartFilter controls; can be modified by users to influence filtering

parameters.name: sorter
parameters.description: An array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Sorter instances of the SmartChart control (personalization); can be modified by users to influence sorting

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: The maximal number of items that is displayed for the SmartChart control

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: a map of parameters which is passed to the binding

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: map of event listeners for the binding events (since 1.56). The events listeners can only be registered while the binding is created. So, ensure that the events parameter is filled from the beginning, so that the registration can be done while the binding is created.

events.description:
This event is fired right before the SmartChart control triggers the binding / rebinding of the inner chart.
Note: In certain cases the inner chart triggers a rebinding by itself. In these cases, the event is not fired.

events.name: chartDataChanged

parameters.name: changeTypes
parameters.description: Object which contains a boolean flag for dimeasure, filter, sort. If set to true, it has been changed.

events.description:
This event is fired when SmartChart control data changes, due to changes in the personalization dialog or drill operations.
The data can be changed via sorters, filters or drill-ups/drill-downs.

events.name: dataReceived
events.description: This event is fired when data is received after binding. This event is fired if the binding for the chart is done by the SmartChart control itself.

deprecated.text: Use beforeRebindChart event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.56. Use beforeRebindChart event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.name: fullScreenToggled

parameters.name: fullScreen
parameters.description: If true the control is in full screen mode

events.description:
This event is fired right after the full screen mode of the SmartChart control has been changed.

Since: 1.46.

events.name: initialise
events.description: This event is fired once the control has been initialized. Note: For compatibility reasons the sap.chart library is loaded synchroniously as soon as a event handler for the initialise event has been attached. Please use event intialized instead.

events.name: initialized
events.description: New event, async successor of initialise

events.name: selectionDetailsActionPress

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action that has to be processed once the action has been pressed

parameters.name: itemContexts
parameters.description: If the action is pressed on one of the items, the parameter contains the context of the pressed item. If a custom action or action group of the SelectionDetails popover is pressed, this parameter contains all contexts of the items.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The action level of action buttons. The available levels are Item, List and Group

events.description:
This event is fired when any action in the selection details popover is pressed.

Since: 1.48.

events.name: showOverlay
events.description: This event is fired right before the overlay is shown.

methods.name: getChart

returnValue.description: The inner chart object

methods.description:
Returns the chart object used internally.
Note: Direct changes made to the inner chart object or its vizFrame might lead to inconsistencies and side effects during runtime, as the SmartChart control doesn't listen to all changes made to the inner chart instance. To avoid this, please use the API provided by the SmartChart control itself.

deprecated.text: Please use getChartAsync instead.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.57.0. Please use getChartAsync instead.

methods.name: getChartAsync

returnValue.description: Promise for inner chart object

methods.description:
Returns a promise which will be resolved with the internally used chart object, once all dependencies have been loaded.
Note: Direct changes made to the inner chart object or its vizFrame might lead to inconsistencies and side effects during runtime, as the SmartChart control doesn't listen to all changes made to the inner chart instance. To avoid this, please use the API provided by the SmartChart control itself.

methods.name: getChartBindingPath

returnValue.description: Value of property chartBindingPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property chartBindingPath.

Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

methods.name: getChartType

returnValue.description: Value of property chartType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property chartType.

Specifies the type of chart to be created by the SmartChart control.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantId

returnValue.description: ID of the currently selected variant

methods.description: Returns the ID of the currently selected variant.

methods.name: getEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoBinding

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableAutoBinding.

If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEntitySet

returnValue.description: Value of property entitySet

methods.description:
Gets current value of property entitySet.

The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns.
Note This is not a dynamic property.

methods.name: getHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property header

methods.description:
Gets current value of property header.

Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

methods.name: getIgnoredChartTypes

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredChartTypes

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoredChartTypes.

CSV of fields that is not shown in the list of available chart types.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

methods.name: getIgnoredFields

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoredFields.

CSV of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartChart control.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

methods.name: getIgnoreFromPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation.

CSV of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

methods.name: getLegendVisible

returnValue.description: Value of property legendVisible

methods.description:
Gets current value of property legendVisible.

Set chart's legend properties.

Default value is true.

methods.name: sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.

methods.name: getNoData

returnValue.description: Value of property noData

methods.description:
Gets current value of property noData.

Defines the custom text that will be displayed in case no data is found for the current binding.

methods.name: getPersistencyKey

returnValue.description: Value of property persistencyKey

methods.description:
Gets current value of property persistencyKey.

Key used to access personalization data.

methods.name: getRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Value of property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property requestAtLeastFields.

CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history.

methods.name: getSelectionDetailsActionGroups
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation selectionDetailsActionGroups.

Actions on group level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

methods.name: getSelectionDetailsActions
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation selectionDetailsActions.

Actions on footer level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

methods.name: getSelectionDetailsItemActions
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation selectionDetailsItemActions.

Actions on item level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

methods.name: getSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property selectionMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property selectionMode.

Chart selection mode. Supported values are sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Single or sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Multi, case insensitive, always return in upper case. Unsupported values will be ignored.

Default value is Multi.

methods.name: getSemanticObjectController
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation semanticObjectController.

The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

methods.name: getShowChartTooltip

returnValue.description: Value of property showChartTooltip

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showChartTooltip.

Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true , an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip will be created and shown when hovering over a data point.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowChartTypeSelectionButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showChartTypeSelectionButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showChartTypeSelectionButton.

Controls the visibility of the chart type selection button.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowDetailsButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showDetailsButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showDetailsButton.

Controls the visibility of the Details button. If set to true, the datapoint tooltip will be disabled as the information of selected datapoints will be found in the details popover. This will also set the drill-down button to invisible.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowDimensionsTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property showDimensionsTitle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showDimensionsTitle.

Controls the visibility of the title in the dimension area of the chart.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowDownloadButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showDownloadButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showDownloadButton.

Controls the visibility of the chart download button.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowDrillBreadcrumbs

returnValue.description: Value of property showDrillBreadcrumbs

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showDrillBreadcrumbs.

Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowDrillButtons

returnValue.description: Value of property showDrillButtons

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showDrillButtons.

Controls the visibility of the Drill Up and Drill Down buttons.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowFullScreenButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showFullScreenButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showFullScreenButton.

Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowLegendButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showLegendButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showLegendButton.

Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowMeasuresTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property showMeasuresTitle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showMeasuresTitle.

Controls the visibility of the title in the measure area of the chart.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowSemanticNavigationButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showSemanticNavigationButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showSemanticNavigationButton.

Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property showToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showToolbar.

Controls the visibility of the toolbar.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property showVariantManagement

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showVariantManagement.

Controls the visibility of the Variant Management.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowZoomButtons

returnValue.description: Value of property showZoomButtons

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showZoomButtons.

Controls the visibility of the Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getSmartFilterId

returnValue.description: Value of property smartFilterId

methods.description:
Gets current value of property smartFilterId.

ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control. If specified, the SmartChart control searches for the SmartFilter control (also in the closest parent view) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter control to fetch data, show overlay etc.

methods.name: getSmartVariant
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association smartVariant, or null.

methods.name: getToolbar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation toolbar.

A custom toolbar that can be specified by the user to define their own buttons, icons, etc. If this is added, the SmartChart control does not create its own toolbar, but uses this one instead. However, if default actions, such as showSemanticNavigation, showFullScreenButton etc. are set, these actions are added at the left-hand side of the toolbar.

methods.name: getToolbarStyle

returnValue.description: Value of property toolbarStyle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property toolbarStyle.

Defines the visual style of the smart charts Toolbar. Note: The visual styles are theme-dependent.

methods.name: getUiState

returnValue.description: Current UI state

methods.description: The method returns the current UI state of SmartChart control.

methods.name: getUseChartPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property useChartPersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useChartPersonalisation.

If set to true, personalized chart settings are defined. If you want to persist the chart personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseListForChartTypeSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property useListForChartTypeSelection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useListForChartTypeSelection.

Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.

Default value is true.

deprecated.text: Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

methods.name: getUseTooltip

returnValue.description: Value of property useTooltip

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useTooltip.

Specifies weather an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip or sap.viz.ui5.controls.Popover is used. If set to true, a tooltip will be displayed, a popover otherwise.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property useVariantManagement

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useVariantManagement.

If set to true, variants are used. As a prerequisite, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setChartBindingPath

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sChartBindingPath
parameters.description: New value for property chartBindingPath

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property chartBindingPath.

Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setChartType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sChartType
parameters.description: New value for property chartType

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property chartType.

Specifies the type of chart to be created by the SmartChart control.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setCurrentVariantId

parameters.name: sVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

methods.description: Applies the current variant based on the sVariantId parameter. If an empty string or null or undefined have been passed, the standard variant will be used. The standard variant will also be used if the passed sVariantId cannot be found. If the flexibility variant, the content for the standard variant, or the personalizable control cannot be obtained, no changes will be made.

methods.name: setEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableAutoBinding
parameters.description: New value for property enableAutoBinding

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableAutoBinding.

If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setEntitySet

parameters.name: sEntitySetName
parameters.description: The entity set

methods.description: The entity set name in the OData metadata against which the chart must be bound.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.description:

properties.name: displayBehaviour
properties.description: The property specifies how value help, that is available for input fields, is presented. For example, it specifies whether the descriptions of the values shown in the result after a query are displayed.

properties.name: preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog
properties.description: If there are value help annotations for a smart field, it is possible to specify whether the table in the value help dialog for this field will be filled initially. The default value is true, which means the table will not be filled as the data fetch is prevented.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField
symbols.description:
The SmartField control interprets metadata that represents entity-relationship models, data types, service capabilities, and annotations in OData services to automatically generate the underlying inner controls and reduce the amount of code needed for developing applications. In some cases, the OData entity is derived from the control's binding context. The OData entity's property that is changed or displayed with the control is derived from the control's value property.

Accessibility

For interoperability and accessibility reasons, the SmartField control must be labeled by the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel control instead of the sap.m.Label control, as the sap.m.Label control does not know of the inner structure of a SmartField control. If the SmartField control is rendered inside a smart container control, for example, the SmartForm control, the SmartLabel control is automatically generated to reduce the amount of code needed on the application side. However, in other scenarios when SmartField is used stand-alone or outside a smart container control, for example, a SimpleForm control, the SmartLabel control is not automatically generated in these cases. Although the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel is a private/internal control, the following basic use is allowed by applications for labeling the SmartField control.

XML Example of a SmartField control labeled by a SmartLabel control

<sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel labelFor="IDProduct"/>
<sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField id="IDProduct" value="{ProductId}"/>

properties.name: clientSideMandatoryCheck
properties.description:
Determines if the mandatory check happens on the client side true or on the server side false.

Note: If the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property annotated as Nullable="false", the mandatory validation is performed on the client side regardless of the clientSideMandatoryCheck setting.

Example:

    <Property Name="CategoryID" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false"/>


Since: 1.38.3.

properties.name: contextEditable
properties.description:
Notifies the control whether controls using the SmartField control are editable.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: controlContext
properties.description:
Defines the context in which the layout of the SmartField control has to be interpreted.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: editable
properties.description:
Indicates whether the control is in display or edit mode.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab order.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The name of an entity set for which the control manages values. This is an optional property.

If this property is left empty, the entity set is computed by parsing the binding context path, for example, Tasks('id-1428419016778-51') is parsed to Tasks.

properties.name: expandNavigationProperties
properties.description:
Indicates if entities related to navigation properties inside the metadata are requested. If set to true, then these related entities are loaded with an $expand request.

Annotations that can have navigation properties are the following:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text for text arrangements
  • Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit and Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency for units
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl for field control

Note: Independent of the fetchValueListReadOnly value, setting this flag to true requests data from the backend.

Note: The back-end request to expand the navigation properties is sent only if the entity to which SmartField is bound is persisted. For transient entities, there is no back-end request since no such data is available.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: fetchValueListReadOnly
properties.description:
Indicates whether the value list collection is fetched in display mode from the resource path specified in the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList annotation.

This collection data is used to infer a descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control. However, fetching the value list collection for every SmartField instance individually may not be ideal in some performance-critical scenarios. To optimize this default behavior, you can set this property to false and provide the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation, which is used to specify the URL path name to the Entity Data Model (EDM) property from which the descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control is fetched, for example, LT (Laptop).

Note: Setting this property to false only has an effect if the value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String. In addition, applications or frameworks have to make sure the descriptive text is fetched, for example, by expanding a navigation property.

Since: 1.42.0.

properties.name: jsontype
properties.description: Data types to be used, if the SmartField control is interacting with a JSON model. If the value property of the control is bound to a property of an OData entity set, this property is not taken into consideration.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.31.0

properties.name: mandatory
properties.description:
Indicates whether user input is required.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven and this property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property is annotated with the Nullable annotation. The Nullable annotation is a capability of the OData service that specifies whether a value is mandatory, hence it overrules the control's API settings. Therefore, if the Nullable attribute is specified as Nullable="false", a value is mandatory.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description:
Defines the highest possible number of permitted input characters that the user can enter into the text input field.

Computed maxLength

If the specified maxLength value is greater than the maxLength value specified for the underlying bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property in the service metadata document, the maxLength value of the EDM property takes precedence. Likewise, if the application code provides a binding data type for the value property of the SmartField control and the binding data type has maxLength constraints defined, this maxLength is also taken into consideration to compute the final maxLength value.

Validation Behavior

By design, the SmartField control does not restrict/validate the highest number of permitted input characters for every keystroke, but only when the text input field has changed, and the browser focus leaves the text input field or the ENTER key is pressed. The SmartField control is used more generically in broader contexts, and adding a maxLength attribute to the HTML text input control may break data type formatting in two-way data-binding scenarios. Let's say the maxLength property is set to 3, but the text input control has a formatter function attached to it to format the entered value "DE" to "Germany (DE)". In this case, the formatted value will be truncated by the maxLength setting.

properties.name: name
properties.description: To be used in the HTML code (for example, for HTML forms that send data to the server via 'submit').

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Text shown when no value available.

properties.name: proposedControl
properties.description:
Proposes a control to be rendered. The SmartField control can ignore the proposal.

Since: 1.32.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32.0

properties.name: showLabel
properties.description: If set to false the label is not displayed.

properties.name: showSuggestion
properties.description: If set to true, the suggestion feature for a hosted control is enabled, if the hosted control supports it.

properties.name: showValueHelp
properties.description: If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the hosted control, if the hosted control supports this.

properties.name: showValueStateMessage
properties.description: Defines whether the value state message is shown or not.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Horizontal alignment of the text.

properties.name: textInEditModeSource
properties.description:
Sets the source from which text descriptions for IDs are fetched in edit mode, for example, for LT (Laptop).

Note: The sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty and sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueList enumeration members are only supported if the following applies:

  • The value property of the SmartField control instance is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String or Edm.Guid.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation for the bound EDM property or entity type is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file.
  • The binding mode for the value property of the SmartField control is the two-way binding mode.
  • The field from which the description is fetched is filterable.

Note: In addition, the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty enumeration member is only supported if the following applies:

  • The EDM navigation property association is defined in the service metadata document.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation for the bound EDM property is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file whose Path attribute points to a EDM navigation property of a lookup entity set/type whose single key property is the ID, which contains (among other properties) the descriptive value.
  • The lookup entity must be loaded. The lookup entity can be loaded by expanding the EDM navigation property via a $expand query parameter.
  • The EDM navigation property association defines a referential constraint that ties values of the dependent editable entity type/set to the lookup entity type/set in the service metadata document.
  • The EDM navigation property association end multiplicity of the lookup entity type/set is defined as 1 in the service metadata document. There must be a single-valued navigation from the editable entity set/type to the lookup entity set/type.
  • The lookup entity type/set from which the descriptive value is fetched contains a single-key EDM property.


Since: 1.54.

properties.name: textLabel
properties.description: This property contains the text of an associated SmartLabel.

properties.name: tooltipLabel
properties.description: This property contains the tool tip of the associated SmartLabel control.

properties.name: uomEditState
properties.description:
This property is for internal use only.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: uomEditable
properties.description:
Indicates whether the unit of measure field is in display or edit mode.

Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

properties.name: uomEnabled
properties.description: Enabled state of the unit, if the SmartField control addresses unit of measure use cases, for example, an amount and its associated currency.

properties.name: uomVisible
properties.description:
Indicates whether the unit of measure field is visible.

Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this property can be ignored if the bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Contains a URL which is used to render a link. The link is rendered, if the OData property, to which the value property of the control is bound, is of type Edm.String and the SmartField is in display mode.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The binding path expression used to determine the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property.

Note: Composite binding expressions for this property are not supported. Note: Custom formatters for this property are not supported. The SmartField control usually creates its own data type based on the service metadata for the formatting of values. Also, when a custom formatter is specified for a property, the binding mode is automatically switched to one-way binding mode. Note: Named models are not supported, only the default model (named undefined) is supported. For example, when the binding path expression contains a > sign, the string preceding it is a named model and the remainder after the > is the binding path.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success, Information.

Note: This method is public because of an implementation side effect and should not be used for validation purposes as it may conflict with the SmartField control's own binding type validation logic based on the underlying metadata of the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Invoking the .setValueState() and/or .setValueStateText() methods in a change event handle to set an error state does not prevent an invalid value from being stored in the binding/model in two-way data binding scenarios. In addition, it does not fire the validationError event, which is usually required by some upstream modules, for example, the message manager.

Custom validation logic must be implemented in a custom binding type rather than in a change event handler.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description:
Defines the text of the value state message popup.

Note: This method is public because of an implementation side effect and should not be used for validation purposes as it may conflict with the SmartField control's own binding type validation logic based on the underlying metadata of the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Invoking the .setValueState() and/or .setValueStateText() methods in a change event handle to set an error state does not prevent an invalid value from being stored in the binding/model in two-way data binding scenarios. In addition, it does not fire the validationError event, which is usually required by some upstream modules, for example, the message manager.

Custom validation logic must be implemented in a custom binding type rather than in a change event handler.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description:
Indicates whether the control break lines (in display mode) to prevent overflow.

Since: 1.36.6.

aggregations.name: _ariaLabelInvisibleText
aggregations.description:
Collects the texts to be used for the ARIA labels.
The InvisibleText controls will be added to the DOM by the SmartField control.

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description: The content aggregation is used to hold the control that is hosted by the SmartField control.

aggregations.name: configuration
aggregations.description:
Optional configuration for SmartField.

Note: By default, the value of the displayBehaviour property is not evaluated in edit mode. To enable this feature in edit mode, set the textInEditModeSource control property to a non-default value.

aggregations.name: controlProposal
aggregations.description:
Proposes a control to be rendered. The SmartField control can ignore the proposal.
Deprecated as of version 1.34.0

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

annotations.name: dataType
annotations.description:
Based on the data type the SmartField determines the rendering of the inner control. Additionally the FieldControl is used. FieldControl is an annotation that contains a collection of EnumMembers that can dynamically set the state of the control. Controls used for the SmartField control during runtime are:

  • sap.m.Input of type Edm.String without value help.
    Used if control is editable and the EntityType is updatable.
  • sap.m.Input of type Edm.String with value help and suggestion list.
    Used if control is editable, the EntityType is updatable, and a ValueHelp annotations exists.

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: fieldControl
annotations.description:
Defines whether a field is mandatory, hidden, or in read-only/editable mode.

An Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be dynamically annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation in OData V4 models or with the sap:field-control annotation in OData V2 models by providing a binding path to another EDM property typed as Edm.Byte whose value in the data model can be:

  • 0; indicates that the field is hidden. Note: Hidden is a deprecated synonym for inapplicable, do not use it to statically hide a field on the user interface, but use the static FieldControl annotation instead.
  • 1; indicates that the field is in read-only mode, and its value cannot be changed. Note: To statically annotate an EDM property as read-only, use the Org.OData.Core.V1.Computed annotation instead.
  • 3; indicates that the field is editable and optional (default).
  • 7; indicates that the field is mandatory from a business perspective. This value does not imply any restrictions on the value range of an EDM property. For restricting the value range use, for example, the standard type facet Nullable with a value of false must be used to exclude the null value, or terms from the Org.OData.Validation.V1 vocabulary must be used.

Example for dynamic use, in a travel expense report the EDM property DestinationCountry is is not applicable if the trip type is domestic, and mandatory if the trip type is international. Whenever the value in the data model of the referenced EDM property changes, the field adapts its state accordingly.

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Annotated with the Dynamic FieldControl OData V4 Annotation in a Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" Path="CompanyCodeFC"/>
   </Property>

   <Property Name="CompanyCodeFC" type="Edm.Byte"/>

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Annotated with the Dynamic sap:field-control OData V2 Annotation in a Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" sap:field-control="CompanyCodeFC"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCodeFC" type="Edm.Byte"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldVisible
annotations.description:
Defines whether a field is hidden.

In OData V4 models, an Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be statically annotated as hidden with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation. A fixed value can be provided as an enumeration member (EnumMember) of the FieldControlType enumeration.

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Hidden in an OData V4 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>

In OData V2 models, an EDM property can be statically annotated as hidden with the sap:visible annotation:

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Hidden in an OData V2 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" sap:visible="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldReadOnly
annotations.description:
Defines whether the field is read-only.

In OData V4 models, an Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be statically annotated as read-only with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

A fixed value can be provided as an enumeration member (EnumMember) of the FieldControlType enumeration.

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Read-only in an OData V4 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/ReadOnly"/>
   </Property>

In OData V2 models, an EDM property can be statically annotated as read-only with the sap:updatable annotation:

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Read-only in an OData V2 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:updatable="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldMandatory
annotations.description:
Defines whether the control is mandatory. A fixed value can be provided as EnumMember FieldControlType/Mandatory of the FieldControl annotation. The mandatory property of the SmartField control renders the field as mandatory input. A SmartField can only be mandatory if the corresponding EntityType is at least annotated as com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Updatable.

XML Example of OData V4 with static Mandatory Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Property Name="Customer">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Mandatory"/>
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Mandatory"/>
   </Property>

For OData v2 the Nullable property on the Property can be used to specify whether the field is mandatory.

   <Property Name="Customer" ...Nullable="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... Nullable="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldMasked
annotations.description:
Determines that a control must not display the actual value in a field with sensitive data, but replace it with a placeholder, for example, *. Use this annotation for sensitive data.

XML Example of OData V4 with Masked Password property

  <Property Name="Password" />
  <Annotations Target="Password" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Masked" />
  </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldLabel
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for labels on user interfaces. Renders the value associated with the label annotation of a Property, which can be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with CustomerName as Label for Customer

  <Property Name="Customer">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label" Path="CustomerName" />
  </Property>
  <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String" />

For OData v2 the sap:label annotation on the Property can be used to assign a label.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:label="Customer Name"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:label="Company Code"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldText
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property. Note: The value must be a dynamic expression when used as metadata annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 Text on CustomerName Property

<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CustomerName" />

For OData v2 the sap:text annotation on the Property can be used to assign a text/description.

   <Property Name="Customer" type="Edm.String" sap:text="CustomerName"/>
   <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldTextArrangement
annotations.description:
Describes the arrangement of an ID value and its description.

Note: By default, this annotation is not evaluated in edit mode. To enable this feature in edit mode, set the textInEditModeSource control property to a non-default value.

The following enumeration members are allowed:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextSeparate: The control displays the specified ID only.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst: The control displays the specified description followed by its ID.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast: The control displays the specified ID followed by its description.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextOnly: The control displays the specified description only.

The TextArrangement annotation is usually used as a child of a com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on an entity's property

<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Category">
	<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CategoryName">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast" />
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on entity Product

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.ProductType">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: fieldCurrencyCode
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
Defines a currency code for an amount according to the ISO 4217 standard. ISOCurrency annotation can point to a Property, which can also be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with Price and CurrencyCode as ISOCurrency

   <Property Name="Price">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency" Path="CurrencyCode" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CurrencyCode" type="Edm.String" />

For OData v2 the sap:semantics="currency-code" along with sap:unit annotations on the Property can be used to assign a currency code to the field.

   <Property Name="Price" ... sap:unit="CurrencyCode"/>
   <Property Name="CurrencyCode" ... sap:semantics="currency-code"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldUnitOfMeasure
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The unit of measure for this measured quantity, for example, cm for centimeters. Renders the value associated with the unit annotation of a Property, which can be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with OrderedQuantity and OrderedUnit as Unit

   <Property Name="OrderedQuantity">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit" Path="OrderedUnit" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="OrderedUnit" type="Edm.String" />

For OData v2 the sap:semantics="unit-of-measure" along with sap:unit annotations on the Property can be used to assign a unit of measure to the field.

   <Property Name="OrderedQuantity" ... sap:unit="OrderedUnit"/>
   <Property Name="OrderedUnit" ... sap:semantics="unit-of-measure"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldScale
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
Defines the number of digits that are to be displayed after the decimal point. This annotation can be applied to a Property.

XML Example of OData V4 with Scaled Price and Weight Properties

   <Property Name="Price">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Scale" Path="PriceScale" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="Weight">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Scale" Path="WeightScale" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="PriceScale" type="Edm.Byte" />
   <Property Name="WeightScale" type="Edm.Byte" />

For OData v2 the sap:precision annotation on the Property can be used to scale the number of digits to be displayed after the decimal point.

   <Property Name="Price" ... sap:precision="2"/>
   <Property Name="Weight" ... sap:precision="3"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldQuickInfo
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for tool tips in user interfaces.

XML Example of OData V4 with Tooltip on CompanyCode Property

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.QuickInfo" Path="CompanyCodeQuickInfo" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyQuickInfo" type="Edm.String" />

For OData v2 the sap:quickinfo annotation on the Property can be used to assign information relevant for tool tips of the field.

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:quickinfo="Company Code quickinfo"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldMultiLineText
annotations.description:
Properties annotated with this annotation are rendered as multi-line text (for example, text area).

XML Example of OData V4 with Multi-line Text Description Property

   <Property Name="Description" />
   <Annotations Target="Description">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.MultiLineText" />
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldUpperCase
annotations.description:
Defines whether a string value is capitalized.

XML Example of OData V4 with Capitalized Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsUpperCase">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:display-format="UpperCase" annotation on the Property can be used to render the text in upper case format.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldDigitSequence
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property contains only digit sequences (non-negative numeric values).

Other input leads to validation errors and the value state message popup is shown. In addition, whenever the control's value property is changed on the user interface side, and the change has to be propagated back into the data model, then the value is either filled with leading zeroes (if the maxLength attribute is given) or the leading zeroes are removed (if no maxLength attribute is given).

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP NUMC (numeric text) data type.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsDigitSequence" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.46.

annotations.name: fieldRecommendationState
annotations.description:
Indicates whether a field has a recommended value. Intelligent systems can help users by recommending input the user may prefer.

This annotation is intended for editable fields for which a recommended input has been pre-filled by a system and is used to highlight a field.

Note: The RecommendationState annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

<Property Name="Name" Type="Edm.String" />
<Property Name="Name_sr" Type="Edm.Byte"/>
...
<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Name">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.RecommendationState" Path="Name_sr" />
</Annotations>

The following values are allowed for the edm:property typed as Edm.Byte:

  • 0 regular: With human or default input, no recommendation
  • 1 highlighted: Without human input and with recommendation
  • 2 warning: With human or default input and with recommendation

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: fieldCalendarDate
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the pattern 'yyyyMMdd'.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the pattern 'YYYYMMDD'.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarDate" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations
