symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar
symbols.description:
The SmartFilterBar control uses the OData metadata of an entity in order to create a FilterBar.
Whether a field is visible on the FilterBar, supports type-ahead and value help, for example, is automatically determined. When you use control configurations and group configurations it is possible to configure the FilterBar and adapt it according to your needs.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: basicSearchFieldName
properties.description: Name of the field that is the focus of the basic search.

properties.name: considerAnalyticalParameters
properties.description:
Indicates if the analytical parameters (SelectionVariant) must be taken into consideration.

Since: 1.42.0.

experimental.text: This property is NOT stable yet. Use at your own risk.

properties.name: considerSelectionVariants
properties.description:
Indicates if the annotation com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant is taken into account.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: defaultSelectionVariantName
properties.description:
Determines one specific variant that is based on the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant annotation, which is then used as the default variant.
This property is only relevant in case considerSelectionVariants is set to true and will only be applied if there is no user-defined default variant specified.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: enableBasicSearch
properties.description: Enables the basic search field. The entered value can be accessed with sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getParameters. Note: When the SmartFilterBar control is used with a sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable control the parameters are handled automatically. Therefore, this must only be enabled for OData service entities that support basic search.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description: The OData entity set whose metadata is used to create the SmartFilterBar. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

properties.name: entityType
properties.description: The OData entity type whose metadata is used to create the SmartFilterBar. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40. Use entitySet property instead of this one, to enable V4 annotation support

properties.name: liveMode
properties.description:
If set the search will be automatically triggered, when a filter value was set via the change event.
Note: The liveMode only operates on non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if liveMode is set, the following applies:

  • The error messagebox is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.
  • The search is triggered after a variant has been selected.
  • Execute on Select for VariantManagement is not shown and not taken into account


Since: 1.40.

properties.name: navigationProperties
properties.description:
This property is only evaluated if the property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getUseProvidedNavigationProperties is set to true. It contains a comma-separated list of navigation property names which are checked for filters.


Since: 1.48.

properties.name: resourceUri
properties.description: Optional. The OData service URL. If it is not specified, the service URL from the OData model (this.getModel()) will be used. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.29. Set an ODataModel as the main model on your control/view instead

properties.name: showMessages
properties.description:
If set to false eventual errors during the search, will not be displayed in a messagebox.

Since: 1.40.

properties.name: suppressSelection
properties.description:
If set to true all search requests will be ignored. This functionality is only intended to be used internally to enable an optimal solution when the filter bar is controlled by the smart templates. NOTE: As long as this property is set to true, all search requests will be neglected.

Since: 1.44.0.

experimental.text: This property is NOT stable yet. Use at your own risk.

properties.name: useDateRangeType
properties.description:
If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

Since: 1.46.0.

properties.name: useProvidedNavigationProperties
properties.description:
If set to true, only the navigation properties mentioned in property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBarl#getNavigationProperties are checked for further filters.

Since: 1.48.

aggregations.name: controlConfiguration
aggregations.description: Using control configurations you can add additional configuration to filter fields, for example set custom labels, change the order of fields, or change the filter field control type. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

aggregations.name: groupConfiguration
aggregations.description: Provides the possibility to add additional configuration to groups. Groups are used to show fields in the advanced area of the SmartFilterBar. With additional configuration, you can for example set custom labels or change the order of groups. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

associations.name: smartVariant
associations.description: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization.

annotations.name: filterRestrictions
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
NonFilterableProperties defines whether a Property can be used for filtering data. All properties are filterable by default. In order to disable filtering capability, these properties must be excluded.

Example using OData V4 annotations on the entity set to excluded Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions">
     <PropertyValue Property="NonFilterableProperties">
       <Collection>
         <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
         <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
     </PropertyValue>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filterable annotation on the Property can be used to exclude properties from filtering.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filterable="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filterable="false"/>

RequiredProperties defines mandatory filter fields. Filter fields with this annotation must be a part of the $filter request sent to the back-end. Note: Support for V4 annotation is added since SAPUI5 version 1.40. XML Example of OData V4 with mandatory filters CompanyCode and Customer

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions">
     <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="RequiresFilter" Bool="true"/>
         <PropertyValue Property="RequiredProperties">
          <Collection>
          	<PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
          </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:required-in-filter annotation on the Property can be used for setting the filter as a mandatory filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:required-in-filter="true"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:required-in-filter="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldGroup
annotations.description:
Defines a group with filter fields. The filter fields are listed as DataField records that reference other properties within the same EntityType.

Example in OData V4 notation with properties CompanyName and CompanyIndustry

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FieldGroup" Qualifier="FieldGroup1">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Custom Field Group 1" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Data">
         <Collection>
				<Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField">
					<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="CompanyName" />
					<PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Customer Name" />
				</Record>
				<Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField" >
					<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="CompanyIndustry" />
					<PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Industry" />
				</Record>
           <PropertyPath>CompanyName</PropertyPath>
           <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterFacet
annotations.description:
Defines the relevant field groups by referencing them as ReferenceFacet. If a filter facet has been defined, only the referenced field groups are displayed in the Adapt Filters dialog, the other filters are omitted.
If you don't define any filter facets all field groups are displayed.

Example in OData V4 notation with two relevant field groups with qualifiers FieldGroup1 and FieldGroup2 (see also annotation FieldGroup for reference)

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FilterFacets" >
     <Collection>
       <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ReferenceFacet" >
         <PropertyValue Property="Target" AnnotationPath="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FieldGroup#FieldGroup1" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Field Group 1" />
     </Record>
       <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ReferenceFacet" >
         <PropertyValue Property="Target" AnnotationPath="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FieldGroup#FieldGroup2" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Field Group 2" />
     </Record>
     </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.

annotations.name: text
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property.

Note: The value must be a dynamic expression when used as metadata annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 Text on CustomerName Property

<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CustomerName" />

For OData v2 the sap:text annotation on the Property can be used to assign a text/description.

   <Property Name="Customer" type="Edm.String" sap:text="CustomerName"/>
   <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: textArrangement
annotations.description:
Describes the arrangement of an ID value and its description.

The following enumeration members are allowed:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextSeparate: The control displays the specified ID only.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst: The control displays the specified description followed by its ID.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast: The control displays the specified ID followed by its description.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextOnly: The control displays the specified description only.

The TextArrangement annotation is usually used as a child of a com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on an entity's property

<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Category">
	<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CategoryName">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast" />
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on entity Product

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.ProductType">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: valueList
annotations.description:
Specifies the structure for the list of possible values. This annotation is rendered as the value help dialog and suggestion list, displayed upon typing. For the suggestion list feature, the annotation without qualifier is used.

Note: This annotation is only supported for Entity Data Model (EDM) properties typed as:

  • Edm.String

Each parameter on the ValueList annotation has a maximum of two properties:

  • LocalDataProperty - Path to the property of the local entity that triggered the ValueList.
  • ValueListProperty - Path to the property of the ValueList entity.

Note: The CollectionPath property does not support paths with navigation properties.

Note: The CollectionRoot property is not supported.

Example in OData V4 notation with property "Category" with a ValueList

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Category" />
       <PropertyValue Property="CollectionPath" String="Category" />
       <PropertyValue Property="SearchSupported" Bool="true" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Parameters">
         <Collection>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterOut">
             <PropertyValue Property="LocalDataProperty" PropertyPath="Category" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="Description" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly">
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="CategoryName" />
           </Record>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: valueListWithFixedValues
annotations.description:
If specified as true, there's only one value list mapping and its value list consists of a small number of fixed values. The value list will be rendered as pick list containing all possible values.

Example in OData V4 notation Value List on Category Property

    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListWithFixedValues" Bool="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.1.

annotations.name: filterLabelOnProperty
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for the filter's name. The com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation is defined on the Property. If the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation is given, it has precedence. If none of the annotations are given, then the label will be the Property name.

Example in OData V4 notation where property "CustomerName" contains the label assigned to property "CustomerId"

    <Annotations Target="CustomerId">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label" Path="Customer" String="Customer Name"/>
    </Annotations>

For OData v2 the sap:label annotation on the Property can be used to define the label of the column.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:label="Customer Name"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterLabelOnLineItem
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for the filter's name. The Label annotation of com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField is defined within com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem annotation. If the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation is given, it has precedence. If none of the annotations are given, then the label will be the Property name of the column.

Example in OData V4 notation where property "CustomerName" contains the label assigned to "Customer" 

    <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField">
        <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Customer" />
        <PropertyValue Property="Label" Path="CustomerName" />
    </Record>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterExpression
annotations.description:
Note: The annotation com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions has been deprecated and replaced by Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions - FilterExpressionRestrictions.

Enum member MultiValue defines whether multiple values can be used in a single filter. With multi-value filtering, more that one "equals" condition can be defined for filtering the data. Example in OData V4 notation with multi-value properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode"

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      <Collection>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/MultiValue" />
         </Record>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/MultiValue" />
         </Record>
      </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filter-restriction="multi-value" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering multi-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>

Enum member SingleValue restricts the filter to only one single value entry. With single-value filtering, you cannot define more than one "equals" condition for filtering the data. Note: Support for V4 annotation is added since SAPUI5 version 1.40. Example in OData V4 notation with single-value properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode"

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      <Collection>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/SingleValue" />
         </Record>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/SingleValue" />
         </Record>
      </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filter-restriction="single-value" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering a single-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>

Enum member SingleInterval restricts the filter to specify an interval, for example, a date interval for filtering the data present between the given dates. Example in OData V4 notation with Interval Restriction on "DocumentDate" property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
     <Collection>
        <Record>
           <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="DocumentDate" />
           <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/SingleInterval" />
        </Record>
     </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filter-restriction="interval" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering an interval filter field.

   <Property Name="DocumentDate" ... sap:filter-restriction="interval"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: FilterRestrictions
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
The filter expression restriction "MultiValue" defines whether multiple filter clauses can be defined in a filter statement. When the expression "MultiValue" is present, multiple filter clauses that use the "equals" operator can be defined by a user.

XML Example of OData V4 with expression "MutliValue" for properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode" 

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions" >
   	<Record>
   		<PropertyValue Property="FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      		<Collection>
         		<Record>
           			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="MultiValue" />
        		 	</Record>
         		<Record>
            			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="MultiValue" />
         		</Record>
      		</Collection>
      	</PropertyValue>
      </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filter-restriction="multi-value" annotation on the property can be used for rendering a multi-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>

The filter expression restriction "SingleValue" restricts the number of filter clauses for the given property to only one in the filter statement. When the expression "SingleValue" is present, a user cannot define more than one "equals" condition for filtering the data.

XML Example of OData V4 with expression "SingleValue" for properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode" 

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions" >
   	<Record>
   		<PropertyValue Property="FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      		<Collection>
         		<Record>
           			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="SingleValue" />
        		 	</Record>
         		<Record>
            			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="SingleValue" />
         		</Record>
      		</Collection>
      	</PropertyValue>
      </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filter-restriction="single-value" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering a single-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>

Note: When the restriction "SingleVale" / "single-value" is used, the "Is Empty" operator cannot be used.

The filter expression restriction" SingleRange" restricts the filter to specify an interval, for example, a date interval for filtering the data present between the given dates. XML Example of OData V4 with expression "SingleRange" for property "DocumentDate"

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions" >
   	<Record>
   		<PropertyValue Property="FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      		<Collection>
         		<Record>
           			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="DocumentDate" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="SingleRange" />
        		 	</Record>
      		</Collection>
      	</PropertyValue>
      </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filter-restriction="interval" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering an interval/range filter field.

   <Property Name="DocumentDate" ... sap:filter-restriction="interval"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.64.

annotations.name: selectionFields
annotations.description:
Defines whether certain fields should be initially visible in the SmartFilterBar control. The fields will be rendered in the order that is specified in this annotation. Note: This annotation is supported since SAPUI5 version 1.40.

Example in OData V4 notation with SelectionFields annotation.

  <Annotations Target="Product">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionFields">
      <Collection>
        <PropertyPath>ProductCategory</PropertyPath>
        <PropertyPath>Supplier</PropertyPath>
        <PropertyPath>Product</PropertyPath>
      </Collection>
    </Annotation>
  </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.40.1.

annotations.name: filterVisible
annotations.description:
Defines whether a filter is visible. The SmartFilterBar control interprets the EnumMembers FieldControlType/Inapplicable and FieldControlType/Hidden (deprecated) of the FieldControl annotation to set the visibility. Note:The FieldControlType/Inapplicable annotation is only supported if you want to statically hide the filter fields.

Example in OData V4 notation with hidden properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode"

    <Annotations Target=".../Customer">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
    </Annotations>
    <Annotations Target=".../CompanyCode">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Inapplicable"/>
    </Annotations>

For OData v2 the sap:visible annotation on the Property can be used to assign visibility.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:visible="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:visible="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: hiddenFilter
annotations.description:
Defines that certain fields are not rendered in the SmartFilterBar control, but still used as filters that can be set by the application code. Note:While properties annotated with HiddenFilter are considered during filtering, properties annotated with Hidden are ignored completely. If both annotations exist, Hidden is taken into consideration.

Example in OData V4 notation with invisible, filterable property "LocationName" 

    <Annotations Target="LocationName" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.HiddenFilter"/>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.44.0.

annotations.name: hidden
annotations.description:
Defines that certain properties are not rendered in an application and also not used in the SmartFilterBar control. In contrast to HiddenFilter, a property annotated with Hidden is not used as a filter. Note:The annotations com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Inapplicable and Hidden are interchangeable.

Example in OData V4 notation with hidden ProductPictureURL

    <Annotations Target="ProductPictureURL" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden"/>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.54.

annotations.name: selectionBVariant
annotations.description:
Defines variant items, based on SelectionVariant annotation. SelectionVariants with a qualifier will be added as variants to the VariantManagement control. A SelectionVariant annotation without a qualifier will define the Standard variant, in case no vendor Standard variant exists. All mentioned filters will be treated as at least partOfCurrentVariant.

    <Annotations Target="Namespace.Product">
        <Annotation Qualifier="Group" Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant">
            <Record>
                <PropertyValue Text="SelectionVariant from Annotations"/>
                <PropertyValue Property="SelectOptions">
                    <Collection>
        			       <Record Type="UI.SelectOptionType">
           			       <PropertyValue Property="PropertyName" PropertyPath="Bukrs"/>
                            <PropertyValue Property="Ranges" >
                     	       <Collection>
                         	       <Record Type="UI.SelectionRangeType">
           						       <PropertyValue Property="Sign" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeSignType/I"/>
           						       <PropertyValue Property="Option" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeOptionType/EQ"/>
           						       <PropertyValue Property="Low" String="0001"/>
                         	       </Record>
                                </Collection>
                            </PropertyValue>
                        </Record>
                    </Collection>
                </PropertyValue>
            </Record>
        <Annotation>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.0.

annotations.name: FilterDefaultValue
annotations.description:
Defines a default value for the property to be used in filter expressions. A FilterDefaultValue is ignored when another source for filter initialization is available, like a com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant or a variant saved with the SmartVariantManagement control.

Note: Analytical parameters (see considerAnalyticalParameters) are technically no filters. To initialize these fields use the DefaultValue attribute of the repsective property in the service's OData metadata.

Example in OData V4 notation for a string-typed property "ContactID"

    <Annotations Target="ContactID" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterDefaultValue" String="A0328" />
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.0.

annotations.name: fiscalYear
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'y' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'y' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYear annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYear" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalPeriod
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'M' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'M' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalPeriod annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalPeriod" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalYearPeriod
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'yM' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'yM' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYearPeriod annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearPeriod" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'Q' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'Q' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalQuarter annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalYearQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'yQ' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'yQ' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYearQuarter annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'w' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'w' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalWeek annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalYearWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'Yw' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'Yw' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYearWeek annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: dayOfFiscalYear
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'd' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'd' pattern.

Note: The IsDayOfFiscalYear annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsDayOfFiscalYear" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/SmartFilterBar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Example: "CompanyCode" & Use "EntityName/GroupName.FieldName" format to get controls from groups. Example:"Account.CompanyCode"

methods.name: getControlConfiguration
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation controlConfiguration.

Using control configurations you can add additional configuration to filter fields, for example set custom labels, change the order of fields, or change the filter field control type. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

methods.name: getDefaultSelectionVariantName

returnValue.description: Value of property defaultSelectionVariantName

methods.description:
Gets current value of property defaultSelectionVariantName.

Determines one specific variant that is based on the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant annotation, which is then used as the default variant.
This property is only relevant in case considerSelectionVariants is set to true and will only be applied if there is no user-defined default variant specified.

methods.name: getEnableBasicSearch

returnValue.description: Value of property enableBasicSearch

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableBasicSearch.

Enables the basic search field. The entered value can be accessed with sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getParameters. Note: When the SmartFilterBar control is used with a sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable control the parameters are handled automatically. Therefore, this must only be enabled for OData service entities that support basic search.

Default value is false.

The OData entity set whose metadata is used to create the SmartFilterBar. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

methods.description:

methods.name: getFilters

returnValue.description: array of sap.ui.model.Filter or multi-filters

parameters.name: aFieldNames
parameters.description: optional array of field names that filters should be returned, if not given all visible filters are returned

methods.description:
Returns an array of filters (sap.ui.model.Filter instances), for visible fields, that can be used to restrict the query result from OData.
The result of this method can directly be used during aggregation binding or OData read.

methods.name: getFiltersWithValues

returnValue.description: Filter items containing a value

methods.description:
Returns all filter items

  • Containing a value
  • With the visible property set to true
  • That are either flagged as partOfCurrentVariant or visibleInFilterBar
  • That are not custom filters
Even hidden filters will be considered as long as the mentioned criteria is fullfilled.

methods.name: getGroupConfiguration
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation groupConfiguration.

Provides the possibility to add additional configuration to groups. Groups are used to show fields in the advanced area of the SmartFilterBar. With additional configuration, you can for example set custom labels or change the order of groups. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

methods.name: getLiveMode

returnValue.description: Value of property liveMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property liveMode.

If set the search will be automatically triggered, when a filter value was set via the change event.
Note: The liveMode only operates on non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if liveMode is set, the following applies:

  • The error messagebox is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.
  • The search is triggered after a variant has been selected.
  • Execute on Select for VariantManagement is not shown and not taken into account

Default value is false.

This property is only evaluated if the property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getUseProvidedNavigationProperties is set to true. It contains a comma-separated list of navigation property names which are checked for filters.

Default value is empty string.

returnValue.description: Binding path of the parameters

methods.description: Returns the binding paths for the parameters. This API can be used for both analytical and non-analytical services. NoteFor analytical services, the API is NOT stable yet. Use at your own risk.

methods.name: getParameterContextUrl

returnValue.description: Parameter context url.

methods.description: Get the parameter context url.

methods.name: getParameters

returnValue.description: A parameter object containing OData query parameters

methods.description:
Returns a parameter object that can be used to restrict the result of an OData service request if a basic search is performed. Example of a returned object:

{
	"custom": {
		"search-focus": "MySearchFocusFieldName",
		"search": "MySearchString"
	}
}

These parameters can be handed over as custom parameters, for example, to the sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataListBinding.

methods.name: getResourceUri

returnValue.description: Value of property resourceUri

methods.description:
Gets current value of property resourceUri.

Optional. The OData service URL. If it is not specified, the service URL from the OData model (this.getModel()) will be used. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

methods.name: getShowMessages

returnValue.description: Value of property showMessages

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showMessages.

If set to false eventual errors during the search, will not be displayed in a messagebox.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getSmartVariant
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association smartVariant, or null.

methods.name: getSuppressSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property suppressSelection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property suppressSelection.

If set to true all search requests will be ignored. This functionality is only intended to be used internally to enable an optimal solution when the filter bar is controlled by the smart templates. NOTE: As long as this property is set to true, all search requests will be neglected.

Default value is false.

experimental.text: This property is NOT stable yet. Use at your own risk.

methods.name: getUseDateRangeType

returnValue.description: Value of property useDateRangeType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useDateRangeType.

If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

methods.name: getUseProvidedNavigationProperties

returnValue.description: Value of property useProvidedNavigationProperties

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useProvidedNavigationProperties.

If set to true, only the navigation properties mentioned in property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBarl#getNavigationProperties are checked for further filters.

Default value is false.

methods.name: search

returnValue.description: Indicates if there are validation errors

parameters.name: bSync
parameters.description: Indicates if the search should be triggered synchronously

methods.description: Overwrites method from base class. Called when user clicks the search button of the FilterBar. The search is executed asynchronously per default, but can be forced to synchronously execution by providing the bSync set to true. Synchronous mode is only supported for non live mode scenarios. In the synchroneous mode a mandatory check prior to the search execution is made.

symbols.description: Groups are used to group group elements.

properties.name: horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth
properties.description:
Specifies the minimal size in pixels of all group elements of the form if horizontal Layout is used.

Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control. So don't set it manually.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. please do not use this property as it does not have any effect on the current layout of the SmartForm control.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Label for the group.

properties.name: useHorizontalLayout
properties.description:
Specifies whether the groups are rendered in a ResponsiveLayout with label on top of the group element. Each group will be rendered in a new line.

Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control.

So don't set it to a different value from the one in the SmartForm control. For performance reasons it might make sense to set it manually to the same value as the one in the SmartForm control when creating the Group element.

aggregations.name: groupElements
aggregations.description: A GroupElement is a combination of one label and different controls associated to this label.

aggregations.name: layout
aggregations.description:
Layout to specify how the group shall be rendered (e.g. span and line-break)

Note: Do not use layout and layoutData aggregations combined.
Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. please use layoutData aggregation instead.

deprecated.text: please use layoutData aggregation instead.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartform.GroupElement

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout
symbols.description: Layout settings to adjust the ResponsiveGridLayout used inside the Form.

properties.name: breakpointL
properties.description: Breakpoint (in pixel) between Medium size and Large size.

properties.name: breakpointM
properties.description: reakpoint (in pixel) between Small size and Medium size.

properties.name: breakpointXL
properties.description:
Breakpoint (in pixel) between large size and extra large (XL) size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: columnsL
properties.description:
Number of columns for large size.
The number of columns for large size must not be smaller than the number of columns for medium size.

properties.name: columnsM
properties.description: Number of columns for medium size.

properties.name: columnsXL
properties.description:
Number of columns for extra large size.
The number of columns for extra large size must not be smaller than the number of columns for large size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: emptySpanL
properties.description: Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on large size.

properties.name: emptySpanM
properties.description: Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on medium size.

properties.name: emptySpanS
properties.description: Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on small size.

properties.name: emptySpanXL
properties.description:
Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on extra large size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: gridDataSpan
properties.description:
A string type that represents Grid's span values for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 1 to 12 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M12", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
The value set here will be set to all group elements when used with horizontal layout (SmartForm property useHorizontalLayout)

properties.name: labelSpanL
properties.description: Default span for labels in large size. This span is only used if more than 1 container is in one line, if only 1 container is in the line the labelSpanM value is used.

properties.name: labelSpanM
properties.description: Default span for labels in medium size. This property is used for full size containers. If more than one Container is in one line, labelSpanL is used.

properties.name: labelSpanS
properties.description: Default span for labels in small size.

properties.name: labelSpanXL
properties.description:
Default span for labels in extra large size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: singleGroupFullSize
properties.description:
If the SmartForm contains only one single Group and this property is set, the Group is displayed using the full size of the SmartForm. In this case the properties columnsL and columnsM are ignored.
In all other cases the Group is displayed in the size of one column.

Since: 1.34.1.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new smartform/Layout.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 1 to 12 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M12", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
The value set here will be set to all group elements when used with horizontal layout (SmartForm property useHorizontalLayout)

Default value is empty string.

Default span for labels in medium size. This property is used for full size containers. If more than one Container is in one line, labelSpanL is used.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property gridDataSpan.

A string type that represents Grid's span values for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 1 to 12 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M12", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
The value set here will be set to all group elements when used with horizontal layout (SmartForm property useHorizontalLayout)

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm
symbols.description:
The SmartForm control renders a form (sap.ui.layout.form.Form). When used with the SmartField control the label is taken from the metadata annotation sap:label if not specified directly.

Warning: Do not put any layout or other container controls into the GroupElement. Views are also not supported. This could damage the visual layout, keyboard support and screen-reader support.

properties.name: checkButton
properties.description: Specifies whether a check button is added to the toolbar.

properties.name: editTogglable
properties.description: If set to true, a button to toggle the editable property is shown in the toolbar.

properties.name: editable
properties.description:
Applies a device-specific and theme-specific line height and label alignment to the form rows if the form has editable content. If set, all (not only the editable) rows of the form will get the line height of editable fields.

The labels inside the form will be rendered by default in the according mode.

Note: The setting of this property will be passed to all SmartField controls inside the form, so they will be editable if the form is editable.

Warning: The setting of this property will not be passed to controls other than SmartField. For example, Input controls in a form with editable set to false are still editable.

If controls other than SmartField controls are used, and the edit mode of their control is not set correctly, this might lead to visual issues. The labels and fields might be misaligned, the labels might be rendered in the wrong mode, and the spacing between the single controls might be wrong. Also, controls that do not fit the mode might be rendered incorrectly.

properties.name: entityType
properties.description:
CSV of entity types for which the flexibility features are available.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: expandable
properties.description: Specifies whether the control is expandable. Per default the control is not rendered as expanded.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: If expandable, this property indicates whether the state is expanded or not. If expanded, then the toolbar (if available) and the content is rendered; if expanded is false, then only the headerText/headerToolbar is rendered.

properties.name: flexEnabled
properties.description:
Specifies whether the form enables flexibility features, such as adding new fields.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.

properties.name: horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth
properties.description: Specifies the minimal size in pixels of all group elements of the form if the horizontal layout is used.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. please do not use this property as it does not have any effect on the current layout of the SmartForm control.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartForm control.
Note:
No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the form.

properties.name: useHorizontalLayout
properties.description:
Specifies whether the groups are rendered in a ResponsiveLayout with the label above the field. Each group is rendered in a new line.

Note: This property should no longer be used. To arrange the fields in columns, ColumnLayout should be used in the layout property.

Note: The value of this property will be passed on to the useHorizontalLayout property of all Group and GroupElement elements.

methods.name: check

returnValue.description: An array of fields with errors

parameters.name: vSettings
parameters.description: Settings object or a boolean which determines if only visible fields in visible groups should be considered. default: true

parameters.name: considerOnlyVisible
parameters.description: Determines if only visible fields in visible groups should be considered. default: true

parameters.name: handleSuccess
parameters.description: Indicates whether client error checks are performed for the current value regardless of the current error state of the text input fields of the SmartForm control. default: false. If the handleSuccess setting is set to true, the sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationSuccess will be fired by every of the text input fields if their validation passes

methods.description:
Checks smart fields for client errors.

This method is typically used to check whether the value of every text input field in edit mode is subject to data type constraints and whether the constraints are fulfilled.

A data type constraint for a bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be violated in many ways, for example:

  • The Nullable constraint for an EDM property typed as Edm.String is violated.
  • A user input is invalid for the bound EDM property typed as Edm.DateTime.

If this happens, the following applies:

  • A validation error state is set on the text input field.
  • A validation error message is displayed for the text input field.
  • The validation error message (possibly generated by a user input) is added to a sap.ui.core.message.MessageManager object instance if, for example, a view object instance is registered to it.
  • The text input field fires a sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationError, or sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:parseError event.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartlist.ListType.List
properties.description: A list (sap.m.List) control shall be created as the content of the SmartList, if no list already exists (default)

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartlist.ListType.Tree
properties.description: A tree (sap.m.Tree) control shall be created as the content of the SmartList, if no list/tree already exists

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.comp.smartlist.ListType

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartlist.SmartList
symbols.description:
A smart control to simplify using the sap.m.List and sap.m.Tree controls in list patterns.

Overview

The SmartList control creates a list or tree based on the configuration specified. There is, however, a difference to other smart controls: This control does not use annotations to automatically create its content. Hence, a template must always be provided for this control.

Structure

The SmartList control consists of the following elements:

  • OverflowToolbar control: Displays the header and other action buttons. Users can add their own toolbar and buttons in the view.
  • List or Tree control: The actual list/tree control. Users can also add this in the view with the required configuration.
The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch the actual data.
The listItemTemplate aggregation must also be specified with the required item template, such as StandardListItem/StandardTreeItem, which will be used during binding.

Note:

Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description:
When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the list using the listBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The entity set name from which to fetch data.
Note:
This is not a dynamic UI5 property.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: expandFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be expanded when request is sent to the backend.
Note:
No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.
This property is only needed when used together with an ODataModel.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: header
properties.description:
Specifies header text that is shown in list.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: listBindingPath
properties.description:
Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the list. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is done automatically or when using rebindList)

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: listType
properties.description:
Specifies the type of list to be created in the SmartList control.
Note:
If you add a List or Tree to the content of the SmartList control in the view, this property has no effect.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: selectFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be selected when request is sent to the backend.
Note:
No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.
This property is only needed when used together with an ODataModel.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: showFullScreenButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the full screen button.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: showRowCount
properties.description:
If set to true (default), the number of rows is shown along with the header text.
If set to false, the number of rows will not be shown on the user interface.
Note:
To avoid sending dedicated OData requests in order to improve your application's performance, you must configure the binding of the list as required.

Since: 1.48.0.

aggregations.name: listItemTemplate
aggregations.description:
Specifies the template that is used for the inner List or Tree control.
Note:
This template is used when binding the items of sap.m.List or sap.m.Tree control, and will not be available in the SmartList control once the binding has been done.

associations.name: smartFilter
associations.description: The SmartFilterBar control to be linked to the SmartList control. Some events of the SmartFilterBar control are then used to fetch data, show overlay etc.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartlist.SmartList

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartAreaMicroChart control creates a AreaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which Micro Area Chart UI will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialised.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: Only true value is supported: the chart will be bound to the chartBindingPath or to the entitySet

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a AreaMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartAreaMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="AmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="AreaChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Area" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#AreaChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartType
annotations.description:
The ChartType is EnumType that is provided within the Chart annotation. The ChartType property value must be Area or Line. XML Example of using ChartType property with Area

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="AreaChartQualifier">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartDefinitionType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Area" />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the color of the chart is defined due to the thresholds by using the CriticalityCalculation property and ImprovementDirection property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType. The total chart property is defined by MaximumValue annotation.

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="AreaChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="PriceTarget"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
         <Record Type="UI.CriticalityCalculationType">
           <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="UI.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="PriceDeviationLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue" Path="PriceToleranceLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeHighValue" Path="PriceToleranceUpperBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeHighValue" Path="PriceDeviationUpperBound"/>
         </Record>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: dataPointType
annotations.description:
The DataPointType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of the DataPoint annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: criticalityCalculationType
annotations.description:
The CriticalityCalculationType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of CriticalityCalculation property in the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using CriticalityCalculation property with the CriticalityCalculationType type

   <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityCalculationType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
       <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="PriceDeviationLowerBound"/>

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartBulletMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the BulletMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) property.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a BulletMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartBulletMicroChart with Chart annotation

   <Annotations Target="BmcNamespace.ProductType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="BulletChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Bullet" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Revenue</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Revenue" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#BulletChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartType
annotations.description:
The ChartType is EnumType that is provided within the Chart annotation. The ChartType property value must be Bullet. XML Example of using ChartType property with Bullet

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="BulletChartQualifier">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartDefinitionType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Bullet" />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes property, the color of the chart is defined due to the Criticality property directly or to the thresholds by using the CriticalityCalculation property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType XML Example of using DataPoint annotation and Criticality property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="BulletChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Price"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Revenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="TargetRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ForecastValue" Path="ForecastRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MinimumValue" Decimal="0"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MaximumValue" Decimal="200"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

XML Example of using DataPoint annotation and CriticalityCalculation property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="BulletChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Price"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Revenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="TargetRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ForecastValue" Path="ForecastRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MinimumValue" Decimal="0"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MaximumValue" Decimal="200"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
         <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityCalculationType">
           <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="PriceDeviationLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue" Path="PriceToleranceLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeHighValue" Path="PriceToleranceUpperBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeHighValue" Path="PriceDeviationUpperBound"/>
         </Record>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: dataPointType
annotations.description:
The DataPointType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of the DataPoint annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: criticalityCalculationType
annotations.description:
The CriticalityCalculationType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of the CriticalityCalculation property in the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using the CriticalityCalculation property with the CriticalityCalculationType type

   <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityCalculationType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
       <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="DeviationLowerBound"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue" Path="PriceToleranceLowerBound"/>

     </Record>
   </PropertyValue>

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartColumnMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartColumnMicroChart control creates a ColumnMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified.
The entitySet property is required. The entity set you specify in this property is used to fetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual chart data.
Note:
Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed, once the control has been initialized.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a ColumnMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartColumnMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="CmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="ColumnChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="ChartTitle" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#ColumnChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title"/>*
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartComparisonMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartComparisonMicroChart control creates a ComparisonMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet property is required to use the control. The entity set you specify in this property is used to feetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual data.
Notes:

  1. Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed, once the control has been initialized.
  2. SmartComparisonMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartComparisonMicroChart cannot be created with a SmartMicroChart.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a ComparisonMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. SmartComparisonMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartComparisonMicroChart cannot be created with SmartMicroChart.
XML Example of SmartComparisonMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="CmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="ComparisonChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#ComparisonChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

symbols.description:
The SmartDeltaMicroChart control creates a DeltaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The delta micro chart represents the delta of two values as a chart.
The entitySet property is required to use the control. The entity set you specify in this property is used to fetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual data.
Notes:

  • Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
  • SmartDeltaMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartDeltaMicroChart cannot be created with a SmartMicroChart.
