symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType
symbols.description: Provides the type of services available for export in the SmartTable control.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.GW
properties.description: Gateway backend spreadsheet export service is used

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.UI5Client
properties.description: UI5 client-side spreadsheet export service is used (default as of UI5 version 1.52)

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.InfoToolbarBehavior
symbols.description:
Enumeration sap.ui.comp.smarttable.InfoToolbarBehavior determines the behavior of the info toolbar in the SmartTable control.

The info toolbar represents the filters that are applied using the table personalization dialog.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.InfoToolbarBehavior.Auto
properties.description: The info toolbar is rendered for the SmartTable control of table type ResponsiveTable only.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.InfoToolbarBehavior.Off
properties.description: The info toolbar is not rendered.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.InfoToolbarBehavior.On
properties.description:
The info toolbar is rendered for the SmartTable control regardless of the table type.

Note: Currently the info toolbar is only rendered for table type ResponsiveTable.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.comp.smarttable.InfoToolbarBehavior

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable
symbols.description:
The SmartTable control creates a table based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which columns will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual table data.
Based on the tableType property, this control will render a standard, analytical, tree, or responsive table.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: currentVariantId
properties.description:
Retrieves or sets the current variant.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: demandPopin
properties.description:
The demandPopin attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to display columns as popins on the responsive table

Since: 1.30.0.

properties.name: editTogglable
properties.description:
Specifies whether the editable property can be toggled via a button on the toolbar. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario)

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: editable
properties.description:
This attribute can be used to specify if the controls created by the SmartTable control are editable. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario)

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description:
When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the table using the tableBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens just after the initialise event has been fired.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: enableCustomFilter
properties.description:
Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog.

Since: 1.26.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns. Note that this is not a dynamic UI5 property

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: exportType
properties.description:
Specifies the type of export to be used in the SmartTable control.

Since: 1.50.0.

properties.name: header
properties.description:
Specifies header text that is shown in table

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: ignoreFromPersonalisation
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
This property must only be used with AnalyticalTable for use cases where a technical field/column is required to fetch some data from the backend but is hidden in the table personalization and on the UI.

Note:

  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • Visible fields/columns cannot be included in this property as this is not supported by the SmartTable control.


Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartTable control.
The SmartTable control will not create built-in columns for the fields defined by this property and will not offer these fields in table personalization.

Note:
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: initialNoDataText
properties.description:
The text shown initially before the control is bound and initialized. The special values $FILTERBAR or $NO_FILTERBAR can be specified to make the SmartTable control show the initial text as if the SmartFilterBar control were associated with it. If nothing is specified, the default behavior is to show the initial text based on whether the SmartFilterBar control is actually associated with the SmartTable control.

Since: 1.58.

properties.name: initiallyVisibleFields
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:
If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description:
Key used to access personalization data.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: placeToolbarInTable
properties.description:
Specifies whether the Toolbar control of the SmartTable is placed inside the corresponding aggregation of the inner UI5 table control.

Since: 1.56.

properties.name: requestAtLeastFields
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that must be always requested from the backend
This property is mainly meant to be used when there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note:
For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • The property name(s) must not point to a new dimension or a measure.
  • The property name(s) must not point to a navigationProperty/association path, as this might not supported by analytical services.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: showFullScreenButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showRowCount
properties.description:
If set to true (default), the number of rows is shown along with the header text.
If set to false, the number of rows will not be shown on the user interface.
Note:
To avoid sending dedicated OData requests in order to improve your application's performance, you must configure the binding of the table as required.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: showTablePersonalisation
properties.description:
The showTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false for controlling the visibility of the TablePersonalisation button.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: showVariantManagement
properties.description:
The showVariantManagement attribute can be set to true or false for controlling the visibility of VariantManagement button.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: smartFilterId
properties.description:
ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control; When specified, the SmartTable searches for the SmartFilter (also in the closest parent View) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter; to fetch data, show overlay etc.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: tableBindingPath
properties.description:
This attribute can be used to specify the path that is used during the binding of the table. If not specified, the entitySet attribute is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: tableType
properties.description:
Specifies the type of table to be created in the SmartTable control.
Note:
If you add a table to the content of the SmartTable in the view, this property has no effect.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: toolbarStyleClass
properties.description:
A style class which is defined for the toolbar of the table.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: useExportToExcel
properties.description:
Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to export data to a spreadsheet application, for example Microsoft Excel.
Note:
If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.GW, any $expand parameters are removed when sending the request to generate the spreadsheet.
As of UI5 version 1.56: If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.UI5Client and TreeTable is used, the worksheet.hierarchyLevel property (see sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet) is filled from the binding, if the relevant information is available there for exporting hierarchical data in the spreadsheet.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: useInfoToolbar
properties.description:
Shows an info toolbar.
Filters that are applied using the table personalization dialog are shown in the info toolbar.
Note:

  • The default value for the property is Auto, which means that the info toolbar is shown by default if table type is ResponsiveTable.
  • The info toolbar is hidden if the property is set to Off.
  • The info toolbar is visible if the property is set to On. Currently the info toolbar is only available for the table type ResponsiveTable.
  • If multiple filters are applied to the same column, then the info toolbar contains the column name only once.
  • In case there is a custom info toolbar used for the responsive table control, then the property must be set to Off. Otherwise, an error is logged in the browser console.


Since: 1.70.

properties.name: useOnlyOneSolidToolbar
properties.description:
If set to true, the standard toolbar and custom toolbar will be merged into one toolbar. The combined toolbar will have a solid style.

Since: 1.26.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.29. This property has no effect

properties.name: useTablePersonalisation
properties.description:
The useTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to define personalized table settings. If you want to persist the table personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: useVariantManagement
properties.description:
The useVariantManagement attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to use variants. As a prerequisite you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

Since: 1.26.0.

aggregations.name: customToolbar
aggregations.description:
A toolbar that can be added by the user to define their own custom buttons, icons, etc. If this is specified, the SmartTable control does not create an additional toolbar, but makes use of this one.
Note:
The CSS class sapMTBHeader-CTX is applied on the given toolbar.

aggregations.name: noData
aggregations.description:
The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance.
The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.
Currently the Responsive Table only supports string values.

aggregations.name: semanticKeyAdditionalControl
aggregations.description:
Allows users to specify an additional control that will be added to a VBox for the first semantic key field.
Note:
This property is not meant for public use.

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

associations.name: smartVariant
associations.description: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.

annotations.name: sortable
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
Defines whether a column can be sorted. Columns are sortable by default. If sorting on columns has to be restricted, then such columns must be listed under NonSortableProperties (exclude from sorting).

The annotation is calculated from the currently bound EntitySet and contains a Property collection of the corresponding EntityType definition. Only PropertyPath for columns to be excluded from sorting can be applied.

For columns added to the content of the SmartTable control, the annotation is not used, and the hosting component needs to take care of correct settings.

XML Example of OData V4 with Customer and CompanyCode Properties Excluded from Sorting 

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.SortRestrictions">
     <PropertyValue Property="NonSortableProperties">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
     </PropertyValue>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:sortable annotation on the Property can be used to exclude from sorting. 

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:sortable="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:sortable="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterable
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
Defines whether a column can be filtered. Columns are filterable by default and need to be excluded.

The annotation is calculated from the currently bound EntitySet and contains a PropertyPath collection of the corresponding EntityType definition. Only PropertyPaths for columns to be excluded from filtering can be applied.

For columns added to the content's table of the SmartTable, the annotation is not used and the hosting component needs to take care of correct settings.

Note: Currently only OData V2 annotation is supported.

XML Example of OData V4 with Excluded Customer and CompanyCode Properties from Filtering 

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions">
     <PropertyValue Property="NonFilterableProperties">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
     </PropertyValue>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:filterable annotation on the Property can be used to exclude from filtering. 

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filterable="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filterable="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnLabelOnProperty
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for the column header's text.

Either com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation on the Property or Label annotation of com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataFieldAbstract within com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem annotation can be used. If com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation is given, it has precedence. If none of the annotations is given the label will be the Property name of the column.

For columns added to the content's table of the SmartTable, the annotation is not used and the hosting component needs to take care of correct settings and translation.

XML Example of OData V4 with CustomerName as Label for Customer Property 

   <Property Name="Customer">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label" String="My Customer" />
   </Property>

For OData v2 the sap:label annotation on the Property can be used to define the label of the column. 

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:label="My Customer"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnVisible
annotations.description:
Defines whether the column is visible. The SmartTable control interprets the EnumMember FieldControlType/Hidden of the FieldControl annotation for setting the visibility. If a Property is set to hidden in OData annotation, then the SmartTable control ignores processing this Property.

Note: Currently only FieldControlType/Hidden is supported for statically hiding the columns.

XML Example of OData V4 with Hidden Customer and CompanyCode Properties 

   <Property Name="Customer">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>

For OData v2 the sap:visible annotation on the Property can be used to assign visibility. 

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:visible="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:visible="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnCurrencyCode
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
Defines a currency code for an amount according to the ISO 4217 standard. ISOCurrency annotation can point to a Property, which can also be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with CurrencyCode Associated to Price Property 

   <Property Name="Price">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency" Path="CurrencyCode" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CurrencyCode" type="Edm.String" />

For OData v2 the sap:semantics="currency-code" along with sap:unit annotations on the Property can be used to assign a currency code to the field. 

   <Property Name="Price" ... sap:unit="CurrencyCode"/>
   <Property Name="CurrencyCode" ... sap:semantics="currency-code"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnUnitOfMeasure
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The unit of measure for a measured quantity, for example, cm for centimeters. Renders the value associated with the unit annotation of a Property, which can be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with OrderedUnit Associated to OrderedQuantity Property 

  <Property Name="OrderedQuantity">
    <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit" Path="OrderedUnit" />
  </Property>
  <Property Name="OrderedUnit" type="Edm.String" />

For OData v2 the sap:semantics="unit-of-measure" along with sap:unit annotations on the Property can be used to assign unit of measure to the field. 

   <Property Name="OrderedQuantity" ... sap:unit="OrderedUnit"/>
   <Property Name="OrderedUnit" ... sap:semantics="unit-of-measure"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnUpperCase
annotations.description:
Defines whether a string is capitalized.

XML Example of OData V4 with Capitalized Customer and CompanyCode Properties 

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsUpperCase">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData v2 the sap:display-format="UpperCase" annotation on the Property can be used to render the text in upper case format. 

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnCalendarDate
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the pattern 'YYYYMMDD'.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP date strings with the pattern 'YYYYMMDD'.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarDate" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For OData v2 the sap:semantics="yearmonthday" annotation on the Property can be used to render a string as date. 

   <Property Name="CreationDate" Type="Edm.String" ... sap:semantics="yearmonthday"/>
   <Property Name="ChangeDate" Type="Edm.String" ... sap:semantics="yearmonthday"/>

Note: The calendar & fiscal annotations of the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1 vocabulary mentioned below right align the columns.

    IsCalendarDate, IsCalendarYear, IsCalendarYearMonth, IsCalendarYearQuarter, IsCalendarYearWeek, IsCalendarYear, IsFiscalYear, IsFiscalYearPeriod

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.54.

annotations.name: lineItem
annotations.description:
Renders the initial columns for the SmartTable control.

XML Example of OData V4 Customer and CompanyCode Properties as LineItem 

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem">
       <Collection>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Customer" />
            <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="CompanyCode" />
          </Record>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

The following record types are supported: DataFieldWithUrl and DataField.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: dataFieldDefault
annotations.description:
Configures the rendering of additional columns (the ones not added using the LineItem annotation) for the SmartTable control.

XML Example of OData V4 Customer Property with DataFieldDefault 

<Annotations Target="Namespace.EntityType/Customer">
	<Annotation Term="UI.DataFieldDefault">
		<Record Type="UI.DataField">
			<PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Label via DataFieldDefault"/>
			<PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="to_Criticality/Criticality"/>
			<PropertyValue Property="CriticalityRepresentation" EnumMember="UI.CriticalityRepresentationType/WithoutIcon"/>
			<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Customer"/>
		</Record>
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

The following record types are supported: DataFieldWithUrl and DataField.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.65.

annotations.name: presentationVariant
annotations.description:
Defines the presentation behaviour of the SmartTable control. A PropertyPath and an AnnotationPath can be used for constructing PresentationVariant annotation.

Note:
The following restrictions currently apply:

  • SortOrder is not evaluated for the ResponsiveTable control.
  • GroupBy is only evaluated for the AnalyticalTable control.
  • Other properties, such as MaxItems, Total, etc. are not supported by the SmartTable control.

XML Example of OData V4 with Customer and CompanyCode Properties as PresentationVariant 

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Visualizations">
         <Collection>
           <AnnotationPath>@UI.LineItem</AnnotationPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
       <PropertyValue Property="RequestAtLeast">
         <Collection>
           <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="SortOrder">
           <Collection>
             <Record>
               <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode"/>
               <PropertyValue Property="Descending" Bool="true"/>
             </Record>
             <Record>
               <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer"/>
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnImportance
annotations.description:
Shows columns with priority high on phones, with priority medium or high on tablets, and with all priorities on the desktop.

Note: Currently the Importance annotation is only evaluated in the LineItem DataField annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 with the Importance Annotation 

   <Property Name="Customer">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/High" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/Medium" />
   </Property>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnDataField
annotations.description:
This annotation can be specified along with the LineItem annotation in order to specify that a property is rendered as a regular data field.

XML Example for OData V4 with DataField Annotation 

   <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField">
     <Annotation Term="UI.Importance" EnumMember="UI.ImportanceType/High"/>
     <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Language"/>
     <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Language"/>
   </Record>

Supported properties are: Criticality, CriticalityRepresentation, Label and Value.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnDataFieldWithUrl
annotations.description:
Renders the value as a URL, if a URL parameter path is present. This annotation must be specified along with the LineItem annotation.

Note:
Currently only odata.fillUriTemplate with LabeledElement for filling the URL parameter is supported in the Apply Function. For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • Any property represented by the LabeledElement or Url annotation must not be a different dimension or a measure.
  • Any property represented by the LabeledElement or Url annotation must not be a navigationProperty/association path, as this is not supported by analytical services.

XML Example for OData V4 with DataFieldWithUrl Annotation 

   <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataFieldWithUrl">
     <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Link to"/>
     <PropertyValue Property="Value" String="Google Maps"/>
     <PropertyValue Property="Url">
       <Apply Function="odata.fillUriTemplate">
         <String>https://www.google.de/maps/{city1}/{street},{city2}</String>
           <LabeledElement Name="street">
             <Path>Address/Street</Path>
           </LabeledElement>
           <LabeledElement Name="city1">
             <Path>Address/City</Path>
           </LabeledElement>
           <LabeledElement Name="city2">
             <Path>Address/City</Path>
           </LabeledElement>
       </Apply>
     </PropertyValue>
   </Record>

Supported properties are: Url, Label and Value.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.1.

annotations.name: columnCriticality
annotations.description:
Represents the criticality state of the data that is present inside the column. This annotation must be specified along with the LineItem annotation. Color coding is also applied to the criticality state based on the provided EnumMember.

Note:
TextArrangement annotation is also considered to format the field (if a Text annotation is present) since 1.54. For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • The property represented by the Criticality or CriticalityRepresentation annotation must not be a different dimension or a measure.
  • The property represented by the Criticality or CriticalityRepresentation annotation must not be a navigationProperty/association path, as this is not supported by analytical services.

XML Example for OData V4 with CriticalityType Annotation 

   <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField">
     <PropertyValue Property="Criticality"
       Path="to_StockAvailability/StockAvailability" />
     <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityRepresentation"
       EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityRepresentationType/WithoutIcon" />
     <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="to_StockAvailability/StockAvailability" />
   </Record>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.1.

annotations.name: columnCriticalityRepresentationType
annotations.description:
Determines if criticality is visualized by means of an icon. The CriticalityRepresentation contains EnumMember that can be used to control the visibility of the icon. An icon is added along with the criticality state by default. If PropertyPath is to be excluded from having an icon, then PropertyPath must be annotated with the CriticalityRepresentationType/WithoutIcon annotation.

Note: For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • The property represented by the Criticality or CriticalityRepresentation annotation must not be a different dimension or a measure.
  • The property represented by the Criticality or CriticalityRepresentation annotation must not be a navigationProperty/association path, as this is not supported by analytical services.

XML Example for OData V4 with CriticalityRepresentationType/WithoutIcon Annotation 

   <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField">
     <PropertyValue Property="Criticality"
       Path="to_StockAvailability/StockAvailability" />
     <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityRepresentation"
       EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityRepresentationType/WithoutIcon" />
     <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="to_StockAvailability/StockAvailability" />
   </Record>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.1.

annotations.name: semanticKey
annotations.description:
Defines whether a property is a semantic key which is used for key columns (rendering sap.m.ObjectIdentifier).
In addition, the Common.EditableFieldFor annotation, which points to a semantic key, can be used for editable properties to achieve the same rendering in display scenarios.

Note: The rendering with the ObjectIdentifier control is only valid for ResponsiveTable scenarios.

XML Example of OData V4 with SemanticKey Annotation 

   <Annotations Target="SalesOrderType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticKey">
       <Collection>
         <PropertyPath>SalesOrderID</PropertyPath>
         <PropertyPath>SalesOrderItemID</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

XML Example of OData V4 with EditableFieldFor Annotation 

   <Annotations Target="NameSpace.SalesOrderType/SalesOrderEditable" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.EditableFieldFor" PropertyPath="SalesOrderID"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.1.

annotations.name: semanticObject
annotations.description:
Defines a name of the SemanticObject that can be represented with a Property that is defined within an EntityType. The SmartTable control creates a SmartLink control by providing relevant information to the SmartLink control.


Note: Navigation targets are determined using CrossApplicationNavigation of the unified shell service.

XML Example of OData V4 with SemanticObject Annotation 

  <Annotations Target="ProductCollection.Product/Name" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticObject" String="SemanticObjectName" />
  </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: columnIsImageURL
annotations.description:
Renders an image in the cell if the annotation is present.

XML Example of OData V4 with the IsImageURL Annotation 

   <Property Name="Product">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsImageURL" Bool="true" />
   </Property>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.1.

annotations.name: columnText
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property.

Note:
The value must be a dynamic expression (property) when used as metadata annotation.
For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • The property represented by the Text annotation must not be a dimension or a measure.
  • The property represented by the Text annotation must not be a navigationProperty/association path, as this is not supported by analytical services.

XML Example of OData V4 Text on Customer Property

   <Property Name="Customer">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CustomerName" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String" />

For OData v2 the sap:text annotation on the Property can be used to assign text.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:text="CustomerName"/>
   <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: textArrangement
annotations.description:
Describes the arrangement of a code value and its text. The TextArragement annotation requires the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation to be defined. The enumeration members can have the following values:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst
    The underlying control is represented with the specified description followed by its ID. This is the default, if no annotation is specified.
  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextOnly
    The underlying control is represented with the specified description only.
  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast
    The underlying control is represented with the specified ID followed by its description.
  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextSeparate
    The underlying control is represented with the specified ID only.

XML Example of OData V4 with EntityType ProductType

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.ProductType">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.

annotations.name: emailAddress
annotations.description:
Indicates whether a Property contains an e-mail address.

XML Example of the OData V4 E-mail Address Annotation

   <Property Name="Email" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Email">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.IsEmailAddress" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.

annotations.name: phoneNumber
annotations.description:
Indicates whether a Property contains a phone number.

XML Example of the OData V4 Phone Number Annotation

   <Property Name="Phone" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Phone">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.IsPhoneNumber" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.

annotations.name: multiUnitBehaviorForSortingAndFiltering
annotations.description:
Indicates whether sorting and filtering amounts with multiple currencies has to be taken into consideration.

Note:

  • During sorting, the currency fields are sorted first by unit and then by value, if the unit has not already been sorted.
  • Filtering is not yet supported.

XML Example of the OData V4 multi-unit behavior for sorting and filtering Annotation

   <Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm"
       Target="Namespace.ProductEntities">
       <Annotaion Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ApplyMultiUnitBehaviorForSortingAndFiltering"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.69.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new smarttable/SmartTable.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: afterVariantApply

parameters.name: currentVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

events.description:
This event is fired after a variant has been applied.

Since: 1.28.0.

events.name: afterVariantInitialise
events.description:
This event is fired after variant management in the SmartTable has been initialized.

Since: 1.28.0.

events.name: afterVariantSave

parameters.name: currentVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

events.description:
This event is fired after a variant has been saved. This event can be used to retrieve the ID of the saved variant.

Since: 1.28.0.

events.name: beforeExport

parameters.name: exportSettings
parameters.description: Contains workbook.columns, dataSource and other export-related information

parameters.name: userExportSettings
parameters.description: Contains the export settings defined by the user

events.description:
This event is fired just before export is triggered.

Since: 1.50.

events.name: beforePaste

parameters.name: columnInfos
parameters.description: Contains array of column info object as determined by the SmartTable

events.description: This event is fired just before the paste event is triggered and can be used to prevent the default paste behavior.

experimental.text: This API is experimental and subject to change

events.name: beforeRebindTable

parameters.name: bindingParams
parameters.description: The bindingParams object contains filters, sorters and other binding related information for the table.

parameters.name: preventTableBind
parameters.description: If set to true by the listener, binding is prevented

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: The combined filter array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Filter instances of the SmartTable and SmartFilter controls; can be modified by users to influence filtering

parameters.name: sorter
parameters.description: An array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Sorter instances of the SmartTable control (personalization); can be modified by users to influence sorting

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: a map of parameters which is passed to the binding

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: map of event listeners for the binding events (since 1.56). The events listeners can only be registered while the binding is created. So, ensure that the events parameter is filled from the beginning, so that the registration can be done while the binding is created.

events.description:
This event is fired just before the binding is being done.

Since: 1.26.0.

events.name: dataReceived
events.description:
This event is fired when data is received after binding. The event is fired if the binding for the table is done by the SmartTable itself.

Since: 1.28.0.

deprecated.text: Use beforeRebindTable event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.56. Use beforeRebindTable event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.name: dataRequested
events.description:
This event is fired when data is requested after binding. The event is fired if the binding for the table is done by the SmartTable itself.

Since: 1.52.0.

deprecated.text: Use beforeRebindTable event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.56. Use beforeRebindTable event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.name: editToggled
events.description:
This event is fired when display/edit button is clicked.

Since: 1.28.0.

events.name: fieldChange
events.description:
This event is fired when an editable field, created internally by the SmartTable control, is changed.

Since: 1.34.0.

events.name: fullScreenToggled

parameters.name: fullScreen
parameters.description: If true, control is in full screen mode

events.description:
This event is fired right after the full screen mode of the SmartTable control has been changed.

Since: 1.46.

events.name: initialise
events.description:
This event is fired once the control has been initialized.

Since: 1.26.0.

events.name: paste

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: Contains parsed/validated paste information returned by PasteHelper.parse API

events.description: This event is fired when paste is triggered.

experimental.text: This API is experimental and subject to change

events.name: showOverlay

parameters.name: overlay
parameters.description: The overlay object contains information related to the table's overlay

parameters.name: show
parameters.description: If set to false by the listener, overlay is not shown

events.description:
This event is fired just before the overlay is being shown.

Since: 1.32.0.

methods.name: applyVariant

parameters.name: oVariantJSON
parameters.description: The variants json

parameters.name: sContext
parameters.description: Describes the context in which the apply was executed

methods.description: Interface function for SmartVariantManagement control, sets the current variant. Note: If an application default variant exists, then all other variants are extended from this application default variant.

methods.name: attachAfterVariantApply

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the afterVariantApply event of this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself.

This event is fired after a variant has been applied.

methods.name: attachAfterVariantInitialise

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the afterVariantInitialise event of this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself.

This event is fired after variant management in the SmartTable has been initialized.

methods.name: attachAfterVariantSave

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the afterVariantSave event of this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself.

This event is fired after a variant has been saved. This event can be used to retrieve the ID of the saved variant.

methods.name: attachBeforeExport

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the beforeExport event of this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable itself.

This event is fired just before export is triggered.

methods.name: attachBeforePaste

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener

methods.name: deactivateColumns

parameters.name: aColumnKeys
parameters.description: An array of column keys by which the corresponding columns are deactivated. If null or undefined or an empty array is passed, no column is deactivated, and all previously deactivated columns will be reset

methods.description:
Deactivates existing columns in the personalization dialog based on the provided column keys.
Note: The columns are set to invisible and excluded from all panels in the table personalization. Any existing sorting, filtering or grouping in the personalization dialog for such columns will no longer be taken into account.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantId

returnValue.description: id of the currently selected variant

methods.description: returns the id of the currently selected variant.

methods.name: getCustomToolbar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation customToolbar.

A toolbar that can be added by the user to define their own custom buttons, icons, etc. If this is specified, the SmartTable control does not create an additional toolbar, but makes use of this one.
Note:
The CSS class sapMTBHeader-CTX is applied on the given toolbar.

methods.name: getDemandPopin

returnValue.description: Value of property demandPopin

methods.description:
Gets current value of property demandPopin.

The demandPopin attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to display columns as popins on the responsive table

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEditable

returnValue.description: Value of property editable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property editable.

This attribute can be used to specify if the controls created by the SmartTable control are editable. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario)

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEditTogglable

returnValue.description: Value of property editTogglable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property editTogglable.

Specifies whether the editable property can be toggled via a button on the toolbar. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario)

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoBinding

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableAutoBinding.

When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the table using the tableBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens just after the initialise event has been fired.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableCustomFilter

returnValue.description: Value of property enableCustomFilter

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableCustomFilter.

Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog.

Default value is true.

deprecated.text: After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

methods.name: getEntitySet

returnValue.description: Value of property entitySet

methods.description:
Gets current value of property entitySet.

The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns. Note that this is not a dynamic UI5 property

methods.name: getExportType

returnValue.description: Value of property exportType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property exportType.

Specifies the type of export to be used in the SmartTable control.

Default value is UI5Client.

methods.name: getHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property header

methods.description:
Gets current value of property header.

Specifies header text that is shown in table

methods.name: getIgnoredFields

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoredFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartTable control.
The SmartTable control will not create built-in columns for the fields defined by this property and will not offer these fields in table personalization.

Note:
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

methods.name: getIgnoreFromPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation.

Comma-separated value of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
This property must only be used with AnalyticalTable for use cases where a technical field/column is required to fetch some data from the backend but is hidden in the table personalization and on the UI.

Note:

  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • Visible fields/columns cannot be included in this property as this is not supported by the SmartTable control.

methods.name: getInitiallyVisibleFields

returnValue.description: Value of property initiallyVisibleFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property initiallyVisibleFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:
If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

methods.name: getInitialNoDataText

returnValue.description: Value of property initialNoDataText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property initialNoDataText.

The text shown initially before the control is bound and initialized. The special values $FILTERBAR or $NO_FILTERBAR can be specified to make the SmartTable control show the initial text as if the SmartFilterBar control were associated with it. If nothing is specified, the default behavior is to show the initial text based on whether the SmartFilterBar control is actually associated with the SmartTable control.

methods.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.

methods.name: getNoData
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation noData.

The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance.
The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.
Currently the Responsive Table only supports string values.

methods.name: getPersistencyKey

returnValue.description: Value of property persistencyKey

methods.description:
Gets current value of property persistencyKey.

Key used to access personalization data.

methods.name: getPlaceToolbarInTable

returnValue.description: Value of property placeToolbarInTable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property placeToolbarInTable.

Specifies whether the Toolbar control of the SmartTable is placed inside the corresponding aggregation of the inner UI5 table control.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Value of property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property requestAtLeastFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be always requested from the backend
This property is mainly meant to be used when there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note:
For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • The property name(s) must not point to a new dimension or a measure.
  • The property name(s) must not point to a navigationProperty/association path, as this might not supported by analytical services.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

methods.name: getSemanticKeyAdditionalControl
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation semanticKeyAdditionalControl.

Allows users to specify an additional control that will be added to a VBox for the first semantic key field.
Note:
This property is not meant for public use.

methods.name: getSemanticObjectController
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation semanticObjectController.

The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

methods.name: getShowFullScreenButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showFullScreenButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showFullScreenButton.

Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowRowCount

returnValue.description: Value of property showRowCount

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showRowCount.

If set to true (default), the number of rows is shown along with the header text.
If set to false, the number of rows will not be shown on the user interface.
Note:
To avoid sending dedicated OData requests in order to improve your application's performance, you must configure the binding of the table as required.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowTablePersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property showTablePersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showTablePersonalisation.

The showTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false for controlling the visibility of the TablePersonalisation button.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property showVariantManagement

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showVariantManagement.

The showVariantManagement attribute can be set to true or false for controlling the visibility of VariantManagement button.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getSmartFilterId

returnValue.description: Value of property smartFilterId

methods.description:
Gets current value of property smartFilterId.

ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control; When specified, the SmartTable searches for the SmartFilter (also in the closest parent View) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter; to fetch data, show overlay etc.

methods.name: getSmartVariant
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association smartVariant, or null.

methods.name: getTable

returnValue.description: the table

methods.description: returns the internally used table object

methods.name: getTableBindingPath

returnValue.description: Value of property tableBindingPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property tableBindingPath.

This attribute can be used to specify the path that is used during the binding of the table. If not specified, the entitySet attribute is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

methods.name: getTableType

returnValue.description: Value of property tableType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property tableType.

Specifies the type of table to be created in the SmartTable control.
Note:
If you add a table to the content of the SmartTable in the view, this property has no effect.

methods.name: getToolbar

returnValue.description: The Toolbar instance

methods.description: Returns the Toolbar instance used inside the SmartTable control.

methods.name: getToolbarStyleClass

returnValue.description: Value of property toolbarStyleClass

methods.description:
Gets current value of property toolbarStyleClass.

A style class which is defined for the toolbar of the table.

methods.name: getUiState

returnValue.description: Current UI state

methods.description:
Returns the current UI state of the SmartTable control.
Note:
The following limitations apply:

  • Visualizations can only be used to modify the visibility and order of columns, the template or importance of the column cannot be changed
  • MaxItems is not supported
  • RequestAtLeast contains values that are combined from both the SmartTable control property and PresentationVariant annotation, but when it is updated it only affects the internal array. The property in the SmartTable stays the same as before
  • Changes to RequestAtLeast alone will not lead to a new data request
  • RequestAtLeast is not supported in AnalyticalTable scenario
  • Any other limitations, like the ones mentioned in sap.ui.comp.state.UIState, also apply

methods.name: getUseExportToExcel

returnValue.description: Value of property useExportToExcel

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useExportToExcel.

Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to export data to a spreadsheet application, for example Microsoft Excel.
Note:
If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.GW, any $expand parameters are removed when sending the request to generate the spreadsheet.
As of UI5 version 1.56: If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.UI5Client and TreeTable is used, the worksheet.hierarchyLevel property (see sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet) is filled from the binding, if the relevant information is available there for exporting hierarchical data in the spreadsheet.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseInfoToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useInfoToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useInfoToolbar.

Shows an info toolbar.
Filters that are applied using the table personalization dialog are shown in the info toolbar.
Note:

  • The default value for the property is Auto, which means that the info toolbar is shown by default if table type is ResponsiveTable.
  • The info toolbar is hidden if the property is set to Off.
  • The info toolbar is visible if the property is set to On. Currently the info toolbar is only available for the table type ResponsiveTable.
  • If multiple filters are applied to the same column, then the info toolbar contains the column name only once.
  • In case there is a custom info toolbar used for the responsive table control, then the property must be set to Off. Otherwise, an error is logged in the browser console.

Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useOnlyOneSolidToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useOnlyOneSolidToolbar.

If set to true, the standard toolbar and custom toolbar will be merged into one toolbar. The combined toolbar will have a solid style.

Default value is false.

deprecated.text: This property has no effect

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.29. This property has no effect

methods.name: getUseTablePersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property useTablePersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useTablePersonalisation.

The useTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to define personalized table settings. If you want to persist the table personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Value of property useVariantManagement

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useVariantManagement.

The useVariantManagement attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to use variants. As a prerequisite you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

Default value is true.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableAutoBinding.

When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the table using the tableBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens just after the initialise event has been fired.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setEnableCustomFilter

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableCustomFilter
parameters.description: New value for property enableCustomFilter

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableCustomFilter.

Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

deprecated.text: After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property ignoredFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartTable control.
The SmartTable control will not create built-in columns for the fields defined by this property and will not offer these fields in table personalization.

Note:
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property ignoreFromPersonalisation.

Comma-separated value of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
This property must only be used with AnalyticalTable for use cases where a technical field/column is required to fetch some data from the backend but is hidden in the table personalization and on the UI.

Note:

  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • Visible fields/columns cannot be included in this property as this is not supported by the SmartTable control.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sInitiallyVisibleFields
parameters.description: New value for property initiallyVisibleFields

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property initiallyVisibleFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:
If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

The text shown initially before the control is bound and initialized. The special values $FILTERBAR or $NO_FILTERBAR can be specified to make the SmartTable control show the initial text as if the SmartFilterBar control were associated with it. If nothing is specified, the default behavior is to show the initial text based on whether the SmartFilterBar control is actually associated with the SmartTable control.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be always requested from the backend
This property is mainly meant to be used when there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note:
For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • The property name(s) must not point to a new dimension or a measure.
  • The property name(s) must not point to a navigationProperty/association path, as this might not supported by analytical services.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

properties.description: A responsive table (sap.m.Table) control that can be used on mobile devices shall be created as the content of the SmartTable, if no table already exists

properties.description: A tree table (sap.ui.table.TreeTable) control shall be created as the content of the SmartTable, if no table already exists

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.PersonalizableInfo

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement
symbols.description:
Overview

The SmartVariantManagement control is a specialization of the VariantManagement control and communicates with the flexibility library that offers SAPUI5 flexibility to manage the variants.

Usage

You can use this control in combination with the following controls:

  • SmartFilterBar
  • SmartChart
  • SmartTable


Documentation links:
  • SAPUI5 Flexibility: Adapting UIs Made Easy

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description: The OData entity set whose metadata is used to create the variant items based on the SelectionPresentationVariant annotation.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data.

aggregations.name: personalizableControls
aggregations.description: All controls that rely on variant handling have to be added to this aggregation.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new SmartVariantManagement.
The call sequence is as follows:
A control for which personalization is used has to be registered first via the personalizableControls association. Then it has to call the initialise method with the arguments fCallback function which will be called once the personalization data has been retrieved and oPersoControl, the control itself.
Note: the function callback has to be defined in the personalizable control.
The old behavior, where the control has to register to the initialise event, before the initialise method call, should not be used any longer and is not supported at all for the page variant scenarios.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
references: {@link topic:a8e55aa2f8bc4127923b20685a6d1621 SAPUI5 Flexibility: Adapting UIs Made Easy}

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementAdapter
symbols.description: Handles the odata metadata based information. An instance of this class will be created and used by the SmartVariantManagement control. The adapter transforms odata metadata based SelectionPresentationVariant information to UIState object. For each SelectionPresentationVariant annotation an entry will be added to the VariantManagement control. It will be called by the SmartVariantManagement whenever the user selects the corresponding entry and will provide a valid UIState object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.state.UIState
symbols.description: Creates a new instance of an UIState class.

properties.name: presentationVariant
properties.description:
Object representing the presentation variant. The structure looks like:


{
	ContextUrl: {string},
	MaxItems: {int},
 SortOrder: [],
	GroupBy: [],
	Total: [],
	RequestAtLeast: [],
	Visualizations: []
}

Note:

  • PresentationVariantID property is not provided
  • Text property is not provided because it is translated text
  • TotalBy is not supported yet
  • IncludeGrandTotal is not supported yet
  • InitialExpansionLevel is not supported yet
  • Title of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • Description of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • VariantName property is not part of specified DataSuiteFormat yet

properties.name: selectionVariant
properties.description:
Object representing the selection variant. The structure looks like:


{
 SelectionVariant: {
     SelectionVariantID: {string},
		Parameters: [],
		SelectOptions: []
}

properties.name: valueTexts
properties.description:
Structure containing filter value keys and its corresponding descriptions.


{
	Texts: [
		{
			Language: string,
			ContextUrl: string,
			PropertyTexts: [
				{
					PropertyName: string,
					ValueTexts: [
						{
							PropertyValue: string,
							Text: string
						}
					]
				}
			]
		}
	]
}

methods.name: setPresentationVariant

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oPresentationVariant
parameters.description: New value for property presentationVariant

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property presentationVariant.

Object representing the presentation variant. The structure looks like:


{
	ContextUrl: {string},
	MaxItems: {int},
 SortOrder: [],
	GroupBy: [],
	Total: [],
	RequestAtLeast: [],
	Visualizations: []
}

Note:

  • PresentationVariantID property is not provided
  • Text property is not provided because it is translated text
  • TotalBy is not supported yet
  • IncludeGrandTotal is not supported yet
  • InitialExpansionLevel is not supported yet
  • Title of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • Description of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • VariantName property is not part of specified DataSuiteFormat yet

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpDialog
symbols.description: The ValueHelpDialog control can be used to implement a value help for an input field.

properties.name: _enhancedExcludeOperations
properties.description:
Used by the ValueHelpProvider to enable enhanced exclude operations

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: basicSearchText
properties.description:
Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: descriptionKey
properties.description:
Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: displayFormat
properties.description:
Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: filterMode
properties.description:
Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: key
properties.description:
Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: keys
properties.description:
Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: maxExcludeRanges
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: maxIncludeRanges
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of include ranges.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: supportMultiselect
properties.description:
Enables multi-selection in the table used.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: supportRanges
properties.description:
Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: supportRangesOnly
properties.description:
If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: tokenDisplayBehaviour
properties.description:
Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

Since: 1.24.

aggregations.name: filterBar
aggregations.description: Allows you to add a FilterBar or SmartFilterBar control to the value help dialog.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new valuehelpdialog/ValueHelpDialog.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: cancel
events.description:
This event is fired when the Cancel button is pressed.

Since: 1.24.

events.name: ok

parameters.name: tokens
parameters.description: The array of tokens created or modified on the ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the OK button is pressed.

Since: 1.24.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: tableSelectionParams
parameters.description: The RowSelectionChange event parameter from the hosted table that contains the selected items.

parameters.name: updateTokens
parameters.description: Returns an array of objects which represents all selected row tokens. The object contains the token key, the row object data from the model, and the information if the token is selected. [{sKey, oRow, bSelect}, ...]

parameters.name: useDefault
parameters.description: Can be set to true to execute the default behaviour of the ValueHelpDialog.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: The table instance used

events.description:
This event is fired when the user selects an item in the items table.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

Since: 1.32.

events.name: tokenRemove

parameters.name: tokenKeys
parameters.description: The array of token keys that has been removed.

parameters.name: useDefault
parameters.description: Can be set to true to execute the default behaviour of ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the user removes one or multiple existing token(s) from the dialog.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

Since: 1.32.

events.name: updateSelection

parameters.name: tokenKeys
parameters.description: The array of existing token keys for which the selection in the table has to be updated.

parameters.name: useDefault
parameters.description: Can be set to true to execute the default behavior of ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the table gets an update and all existing tokens must be selected in the table.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

Since: 1.32.
